properties.notes: On 17 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, Haiti and Kenya police forces clashed with gang members as they carried out a joint patrol with armored vehicles near the National Palace (Champs de Mars neighbourhood), and near Grand-Rue street (Centre-Ville neighbourhood). Clashes also took place at the National Port Authority (APN) facilities, in La Saline. Security forces managed to regain control of the APN, which had been under the control of gangs for several months. Casualties unknown.

On 17 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed four armed men during a clash in the Carrefour Feuilles neighbourhood. The now deceased were described as suspect abductors. They were intercepted as they were moving in a vehicle which was set on fire (no further details reported). One of the bodies was found burned. 4 fatalities.

On 15 July 2024, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, in the morning, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang set fire to several vehicles, including one belonging to the 'Yaya' water treatment company, on the National Road 1. The criminals aggressed public transport drivers and traders (nature of the aggressions unspecified). It happened as the gang members clashed with police forces in nearby Pont Sonde (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 15 July 2024, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a fourth consecutive day, police officers and members of the Chandelle self-defence group clashed with scores of Baz Gran Grif de Savien gang members as they tried to attack and demolish the Pat-Chwal sub-police station, on the National Road 1. There were several injured by gunshots among civilians. Between 13 and 15 July, at least eight gang members were killed amidst clashes. An unspecified number of others were injured. Some unidentified corpses were found in nearby Moreau Paye in the morning of 16 July (assumed as likely victims of armed clashes). 8 fatalities split across three events.

On 14 July 2024, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a third consecutive day, overnight, around 20 police officers and members of the Chandelle self-defence group clashed with scores of Baz Gran Grif de Savien gang members as they tried to attack and demolish the Pat-Chwal sub-police station, on the National Road 1. During clashes, at least two gang members were killed and a third one was injured. At least four self-defence group members were killed and 11 others were wounded while they supported the police. There were several injured by gunshots among civilians. Armed clashes continued on 15 July (coded separately). Between 13 and 15 July, at least eight gang members were killed amidst clashes. An unspecified number of others were injured. 8 fatalities split across three events, including the at least six people killed in this clash.

On 13 July 2024, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, for a second consecutive day, police officers and members of the Chandelle self-defence group clashed with scores of Baz Gran Grif de Savien gang members as they tried to attack and demolish the Pat-Chwal sub-police station, on the National Road 1. There were several injured by gunshots among civilians. Between 13 and 15 July, at least eight gang members were killed amidst clashes. An unspecified number of others were injured. 8 fatalities split across three events.

On 12 July 2024, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, overnight, police forces and members of the Chandelle self-defence group clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang as they tried to take control of the Pat-Chwal sub-police station. Security forces managed to prevent the criminals from success, although they had to leave due to a shortage of ammunition. Clashes continued for at least four consecutive days (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 12 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, an unknown number of people were abducted in Delmas 19. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 11 July 2024, near Pont Sonde, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang kidnapped at least 20 civilians from their homes in Moreau Paye. The gang members asked for the payment of ransoms as a condition for their liberation. The victims were taken to Savien, although their whereabouts are unknown.

On 11 July 2024, in Jeremie, Grande-Anse, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang killed four men as they attacked and took refuge in the commune. The victims, who were members of the same family, were decapitated. According to residents, members of this gang are seeking refuge from the operations of the Kenyan police. 4 fatalities.

On 8 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, unidentified men wearing bulletproof vests kidnapped a merchant in a market in the Telele market (Jacquet neighborhood). Latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 7 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped a notary man together with two of his family members when they were hiking in Laboule 12 (Thomassin neighbourhood). There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 7 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, armed gang members kidnapped a businessman at the height of the Avenue Christophe neighbourhood. The wife of the victim, who was inside their private vehicle, was about to be kidnapped too, although security forces intervened and prevented it (nature of the interaction with the perpetrators unreported). The abductors managed to escape with the businessman. His whereabouts are unknown.

On 6 July 2024, in Bon Repos, Ouest, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped a doctor in the Lizon neighbourhood. The abductors asked for a ransom as a condition for his release. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

Around 6 July 2024 (between 5 - 7 July), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped an unspecified number of people in Plaine du Cul-de-Sac area. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 6 July 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped a doctor man in Delmas 19 (Delmas 19/Mackandal neighbourhood). There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim was released under unclarified circumstances.

Around 6 July 2024 (between 5 - 7 July), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped an unspecified number of people in the Turgeau neighbourhood. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 6 July 2024 (between 5 - 7 July), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, an unknown number of people were abducted in Riviere Froide. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.
On 5 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the Belair Gang shot and injured several people as they attacked the Fort-National and Solino neighborhoods. Several injured.
On 4 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, two gang members on a motorcycle shot and killed two men on the Panamerican Road (drive-by). Motivation unknown. 2 fatalities.
On 4 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the Belair Gang shot and injured several people as they attacked the Fort-National and Solino neighborhoods. Several injured.

On 4 July 2024, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, in the morning, the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang injured and kidnapped several people as they perpetrated an attack in the area. Several vehicles were stolen. The victims' whereabouts are unknown. Several injured.

On 4 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, armed members of the Viv Ansanm Gang shot and killed two police officers and a civilian (described as a close person to the officers) on Genet Street, in Arcachon 32 (Arcachon/Mon-Repos neighbourhood). Several people were injured. The gangsters took away the officers' bodies. One source stated that the killed officers used to collaborate with the Caravane Gang and that they were killed for stop supporting it. There were police officers (affiliated to the Caravane Gang) among the perpetrators of the attack. 3 fatalities, several injured.
On 3 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in La Conille area (South of the commune). Casualties unknown.

On 1 July 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, in the morning, the Viv Ansanm Gang, the 103 Zombies Gang, and the Grand-Ravine Gang demolished a part of the Gressier sub-police station, which had been under attack since the night prior (coded separately). The gangsters, armed with sled hammers, managed to bring down the building's fences. Police forces intervened and clashed with the gangsters, killing several of them. The police managed to gained the control of the sub-police station after clashes. During the offensive, houses were set on fire and at least five civilians were killed, including a minibus driver man by gunshots along the National Road 1. His body was burned. The gangsters kidnapped a Catholic priest from inside a church and asked for a ransom for his liberation. He was released the day after under unclarified circumstances. At least 5 fatalities.

On 30 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, overnight, more than 200 members of the Viv Ansanm Gang, the 103 Zombies Gang, and the Grand-Ravine Gang, attacked and partially burned the Gressier sub-police station. Some officers were taken as hostages while others were forced to leave. Following this, the gangsters attacked residents at their homes, shooting, raping, and extorting them. A number of houses were set on fire with residents inside, killing at least 20 civilians. Among the fatal victims, there was a cousin of the Gressier's mayor. He was killed in front of his family and burned. Transport vehicles were hijacked on the National Road 2. Some public transport drivers were killed while several passengers were robbed and aggressed. Police forces responded and clashed with the gangsters for several hours. An unspecified number of criminals were killed. Two police armoured vehicles were attacked. Hundreds of gangsters were seen parading along the commune's beaches. Three roadblocks were erected by the mentioned gangs in separate areas in the commune. A priest who was also kidnapped from the Gressier parish during the incident was released on 2 July. At least 20 fatalities.

On 26 June 2024, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, an unknown number of armed men killed a coordinator of the Board of Directors of the Municipal Section (CASEC) and burned his body. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 June 2024, in Miragoane, Nippes, police forces shot and killed a member of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang). The officers were under the orders of the Miragoane police commissionaire. 1 fatality.

On 25 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, three armed civilians (described as police officers by one source) entered a police station in the aim of releasing two individuals who had been arrested moments before. Within the station, the three rioters assaulted an unknown number of on-duty officers, and robbed them. The rioters were eventually arrested. Their arms were seized.
On 25 June 2024, in Mirebalais, Centre, residents captured a Taliban gang member and executed him as part of the Bwa Kale Movement after interrogating him on his gang activities. 1 fatality.

Around 24 June 2024 (between 23 - 25 June), near Carrefour Paye, Aritbonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang kidnapped at least eight people and hijacked several trucks on the National Road 1, at the height of Moreau Paye. The abductors asked for a ransom of several million dollars as a condition for the release of the victims. Their whereabouts are unknown.

On 23 June 2024, in Marassa, Ouest, overnight, police forces clashed with 400 Mawozo gang members during several hours as part of an operation in their base. Gunshots were also heard. Casualties unknown.

On 22 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, the Ti Bwa Gang leader (alias Krisla) engaged in armed clashes with members of a rival gang in the Fontamara neighbourhood. Clashes erupted after the Ti Bwa gang held a member of the rival organization the day prior. During clashes, a Ti Bwa Gang affiliated was shot and killed. 1 fatality.

On 20 June 2024, in Saint Michel du Sud, Nippes, police forces shot and killed a man described as a gang member operating in Mariani. The killing took place under the orders of the Miragoane police commissioner, Ernst Muscadin. 1 fatality.

On 19 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, members of the Nan Boston Gang clashed with the Simon-Pele Gang. Gunshots were heard around Station Gonaives and the Varreux Terminal (Hasco/Village Democratie neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances of the clash. Casualties unknown.

On 16 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, overnight, an unknown number of armed masked individuals dressed in police uniforms entered a property in the Delmas 33 neighbourhood and killed three men and a woman. They were brothers and she was a cousin of them. The motivation for the attack was not clarified, although several individuals close to the victims claimed that they were targeted due to their origin. It is known that they had fled Delmas 9 due to the Viv Ansamn Gang violence. 4 fatalities.
On 15 June 2024, in Saint-Louis du Sud, Sud, overnight, police forces shot and killed a gang member during a security operation in an area known as 'Mon Zoranje'. 1 fatality.

On 14 June 2024, in Grande Plaine, Artibonite, around 30 members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang riding motorcycles set fire to around 10 houses and killed four residents in the village. Sources stated that the gang members came from Tibwadon area. Earlier that day, these same gang members had killed six residents during an attack in nearby Terre Neuve (coded separately). These attacks resulted in more than 10 fatalities, at least 15 injured, and around 20 houses burned between Terre Neuve and Grande Plaine. At least 4 fatalities, several injured.

On 14 June 2024, in Saint-Marc, Artibonite, Ouest, overnight, at least two members of the Timonette Gang assaulted and disarmed two security guards working at the Ti Malice company's facilities, in the Timonette communal section. The criminals set fire to several nearby houses before fleeing with the stolen arms. As the company's private security team boarded a truck and chased the criminals, members of the same gang managed to hijack the vehicle at the height of Pont-Sonde. They fled with the stolen items. Two gang members, including the leader of the gang, were arrested on 16 June (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 14 June 2024, in Terre Neuve, Artibonite, around 30 members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang riding motorcycles attacked residents in the Lagon communal section, shooting and killing six civilians and injuring a woman. Among the fatal victims, there were an Evangelical pastor from the Bethel Church (also described as head of a school), and two other teachers. The religious man had been kidnapped moments before being killed. The house of a former coordinator of the regional Board of Directors of the Municipal Section (CASEC) was set on fire. After the attack, the gangsters left the commune and killed four other civilians in nearby Grande Plaine (coded separately). These attacks resulted in more than 10 fatalities, at least 15 injured, and around 20 houses burned between Terre Neuve and Grande Plaine. At least 6 fatalities, at least 1 injured.

On 14 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members during an anti-gang operation launched in response to the killing of three police officers on 9 June (coded separately). Gunshots were heard in Bas Delmas (Chancerelles neighbourhood). Casualties unknown.

On 12 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, people demonstrated in Bourdon. According to the report, police was present, but no specific actions were reported. Another report indicates that gunshots were heard on the Bourdon road, but it is not clear if they were related to the demonstration. The demonstrators continued towards Christ-Roi and Delmas 32. Burning tires were registered between the two areas. There is no information on the motives of the demonstration.

On 12 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for a third consecutive day, a group of residents held a demonstration in the Nazon neighbourhood to decry the killing of three police officers by gang members on 9 June (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires. Gunshots were heard. The mobilization was held on the occasion of the anniversary of the National Police of Haiti.

On 12 June 2024, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, scores of residents took to the streets calling for the return of the head of the police in the Sud-Est department. He had resigned the day prior after police officers called on his departure due to working conditions (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires on Baranquilla Avenue.

On 12 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Bas Delmas as they carried out an anti-gang operation launched in response to the killing of three police officers in Delmas 18 on 9 June (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 11 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, a group of residents held a demonstration in the Nazon neighbourhood to decry the killing of three police officers by gang members on 9 June (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires.

On 11 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, a group of people held a demonstration in the Carrefour Aeroport/Delmas 13 neighbourhood to decry the killing of three police officers by gang members on 9 June (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires.

On 11 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, members of the Living Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) opened fire on a group of residents in Delmas 24 (Sylvio Cator/Delmas 28 neighbourhood), killing at least 10 and injuring several others. The gang members shot from inside a house. The group of targeted civilians had been escorted by a police armored vehicle moments before the attack. At least 10 fatalities.

On 10 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several dozen residents held a demonstration in the Solino and Nazon neighborhoods to decry the killing of three police officers near Delmas 19 the day prior (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires.
On 10 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, in the morning, the leader of the G-9 Gang launched an attack and set fire to several houses and schools in the commune. Casualties unknown.

On 9 June 2024, in Jacmel, Sud-Est, overnight, a mob of residents lynched four gang members. The victims were affiliates of the 6 Men For Hell Gang, which is based in the nearby Watapana village. 4 fatalities.

On 9 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, members of the Living Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) ambushed a police armored vehicle between Delmas 18 Avenue and Sans Fil Street (in the Cite Numero Un neighbourhood). Three police officers were killed and another one was injured. The bodies of the deceased were decapitated and burned together with the police vehicle. Additional police officers arrived and clashed with the criminals in Delmas 18, in nearby Delmas 24 (Sylvio Cator/Delmas 28 neighbourhood), and in Solino neighbourhood (coded separately). The Viv Ansanm Gang, which claimed responsibility for the attack, shared images of the victims' bodies, weapons and ammunition they stole, on social media. At least one of the corpses was taken by the gang members. 3 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 9 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Living Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) in the Solino neighbourhood. Several civilians were injured. Clashes took place moments after the criminals had ambushed police officers in an armored vehicle in nearby Delmas 18 Avenue, in Cite Numero Un neighbourhood (coded separately). Several injured.

On 8 June 2024, in Fonds-Parisien, Ouest, a mob of residents stoned to death a member of the 400 Mawozo Gang who had been arrested by the Dominican forces and transferred to the Haitian authorities earlier that day. The body of the victim was burned. 1 fatality.
On 5 June 2024, in Chalon, Nippes, police forces shot and killed a gang member who had escaped the prison in March. He was killed during an operation that aimed at seizing him. 1 fatality.

On 4 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, the police clashed with gang members around Rue Oge (Centre Ville (Sud) neighborhood) and Rue Geffrard (Morne Hercule neighborhood). Casualties unknown.

On 4 June 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members near the Carrefour Aeroport neighbourhood as they intervened to prevent the criminals from hijacking vehicles in the mentioned area and in Delmas 3 (located in Delmas 5 neighbourhood). It is known that the gangsters had forced the driver of a tanker truck transporting gasoline to divert the march towards Delmas 18. In the Carrefour Aeroport neighbourhood, the gang members opened fire on a driver and his vehicle, and set it on fire. Casualties unknown.

Around 3 June 2024 (as reported), in Cerca-Carvajal, Centre, two brothers were stabbed to death with machetes and their bodies were found in the village. The motivation for the attack was said to be a land dispute. 2 fatalities.

Around 3 June 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals killed three police officers and injured a fourth one while they were on duty on the Freres Road. 3 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 3 June 2024, in Petit Trou de Nippes, Nippes, police forces shot and killed a gang member and arrested three others during a security operation aiming at seizing them and preventing them from attacking the Anse-a-Veau civil prison in support of a local gang. The criminals belonged to a gang from Mariani. 1 fatality.

On 2 June 2024, in Belle-Anse, Sud-Est, a mob of residents captured and lynched an armed man in the Mare-Briole neighbourhood. The attack took place moments after the victim had shot and injured a man as he opened fire on a crowd and tried to flee from the police. The firearm was seized. 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a mob of residents killed a gang member in the Solino neighbourhood as police forces clashed with the criminals after they attacked residents and their houses in the area (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 30 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members as they attacked residents and set fire to houses in the Solino neighbourhood. Gunshots were heard for several hours. According to witnesses, several gang members were killed and some residents were injured. One of the deceased gangsters was killed by a mob of residents (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 30 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members as they attacked residents and set fire to houses in Delmas 24 (Sylvio Cator/Delmas 28 neighbourhood). Gunshots were heard for several hours. According to witnesses, several gang members were killed and some residents were injured. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 29 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, armed gang members on a motorcycle shot and killed a teacher man and head of the School 'Sisters Saint Mary of the Angels' on the Capois street, where the institution is located (Bas Peu de Choses neighbourhood) (drive-by). The victim was said to be driving next to the school when he got shot and lost the control of the vehicle, crashing with a house. According to several sources, the shooting happened as the victim tried to resist a kidnapping attempt. The perpetrators fled the scene. 1 fatality.

On 29 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members shot and injured three employees of the Port-au-Prince city hall's road services section as they perpetrated an attack in the Bicentenaire neighbourhood. 3 injured.

On 27 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, armed members of the 103 Zombies Gang clashed with police forces in the Colombier area (Fierte Ville neighbourhood). Clashes took place after the criminals threw Molotov cocktails and set fire to a broken down police vehicle on the National Road 2. The vehicle had been abandoned by the officers moments before. Several sources stated that a police officer was injured amidst the clashes, while residents claimed that he was killed together with several gang members. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 May 2024, in Bon Repos, Ouest, overnight, members of the Living Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) moving in three trucks ambushed three Evangelical missionaries (a US woman, a US man, and a Haitian man) who were travelling in a vehicle with their children. The attack happened moments after the victims had left a church in the Lizon neighbourhood, in La Plaine du Cul-de-Sac area. The gang members beat up the US man and forced him to drive them to his home, where the three missionaries were killed. The property was looted and the corpse of the US missionary was found tied up and partially burned. According to latest reports, the gang members who took the victims to the house were different from the gangsters who killed them moments later. One source stated that as the members of a second gang arrived to the property, a gangster got shot and killed (assumed by the other gang members), and the victims got trapped in armed clashes. Another version stated that the Haitian man, who was the local head of the missionary group they belonged to, was directly killed after being recognized for his work. The three used to work at the Bon Espoir orphanage. The US citizens were the daughter and son-in-law of a local politician from Missouri (US). The bodies were retrieved through the mediation of the Kraze Barye Gang (Vitelhomme Gang), which was said not to be involved in the attack. 4 fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, unidentified gang members kidnapped several employees after breaking into the Bon Espoir orphanage in Lizon 41. The victims have not been identified. Gunshots were heard in Lizon 26, 35, 39, and 41 until late during the night. The report indicates that the incident took place in a gang leader's territory. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 23 May 2024 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, members of the Living-Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked the Carrefour police station. Casualties unknown.
On 23 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in the commune. Casualties unknown.
On 22 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals shot and killed a businessman on the N Avenue, in the Pacot neighbourhood. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 21 May 2024, in Thomazeau, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, the 400 Mawozo Gang attacked the Dalman neighbourhood, killing four people and setting fire to more than 10 houses. Among the victims, there was a fisherman who was decapitated. The headquarters of the LiveBeyond Foundation were looted and vandalized. 4 fatalities.

On 21 May 2024, in Hatte Lathan, Ouest, armed gang members attacked and set fire to the Cesse-Lesse police station (a.k.a. Corail police station). The attack was attributed to the Living-Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang). Casualties unknown.

On 21 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, members of the Living-Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked a police station in the Pont Rouge neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.
Around 21 May 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, gang members killed several civilians in the commune. Houses were set on fire. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 20 May 2024, in Thomazeau, Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang attacked residents in the Dalman neighbourhood and destroyed everything they found on their way (no further details mentioned). According to sources, residents resisted and the gang members left the area in search of reinforcements. The gangsters came back a day later and killed four people (coded separately). There were no casualties.

On 20 May 2024, in Mirebalais, Centre, a mob of residents lynched two women and a man who had been arrested by the police earlier that day. The victims, who were taken from a detention centre, were described as members of a gang. The lynching was perpetrated by affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement. 3 fatalities.

On 19 May 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces clashed with gang members in the commune. Clashes took place after the 400 Mawozo Gang used an excavator to destroy the Croix-des-Bouquets police station and other facilities on 17 May (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 19 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several gang members during an anti-gang operation in the commune. Several firearms and other items were seized. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 18 May 2024, in Fond d'Icaque, Grande-Anse, a group of 30 individuals dressed in black clothes and led by a Catholic Christian priest attacked a female voodoo leader and her daughter as they participated in a march on the occasion of the Flag Festival commemoration. The rioters threatened to stone the victims and set them on fire. No further details were mentioned. The attack seemed to be a hate crime.

On 18 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, gang members attacked the Laboule neighbourhood. According to residents, the gangsters remained present in the neighbourhood for several days. Casualties unknown.

On 18 May 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in the commune. Clashes took place a day after the 400 Mawozo Gang used an excavator to destroy the Croix-des-Bouquets police station and other facilities (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 17 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a member of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) during a clash in the Colosso area, in Tabarre 42. A firearm was seized. 1 fatality.

On 17 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, affiliates of the Living-Together gang alliance assaulted the Superior Court of Account and Administrative Disputes, located on the Reunion Street (in the Centre Ville neighbourhood). Police forces intervened and forced the criminals to leave the Court, although they managed to steal some materials. The gang members had tried to assault the building the day prior (coded separately).

On 16 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, affiliates of the Living-Together gang-led alliance (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked residents in the Fort National neighbourhood. Houses were set on fire. The criminals also targeted state facilities in the Champs de Mars neighbourhood (the Ministry of the Interior and the Finances Palace). In the Centre Ville neighbourhood, they assaulted the Superior Court of Account and Administrative Disputes and stole some materials. They fled moments before the police arrived. Several nearby buildings, including the Palace of Ministries (on the Reunion street) and an Adventist Protestant Church (in Morne a Tuf neighbourhood) were looted and vandalized. Gunshots were heard in Fort National, Poste Marchand, and Poupelard (Port-au-Prince - Saint Antoine/Lalue neighbordhood). Casualties unknown.

On 15 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, the Belair Gang attacked residents in the Fort National neighbourhood. A number of houses were set on fire. Many residents fled their homes. The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living-Together gang-alliance. Casualties unknown.

On 15 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the population lynched a member of the Kraze Barye Gang in Pernier 12. The gangster was using a truck to kidnap people when he was stopped by the residents who attacked him. 1 fatality.

On 14 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the Belair Gang attacked residents in the Fort National and Solino neighborhoods and clashed with police forces, who intervened and expelled the criminals from these areas. Clashes spread to the nearby Delmas 24 area (coded separately). Several civilians and several gang members were killed. Houses were set on fire. The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 14 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, the Belair Gang attacked residents in the Delmas 24 area (located in the Sylvio Cator/Delmas 28 neighbourhood) and clashed with police forces, who intervened and expelled the criminals from the area. Several civilians and several gang members were killed. Houses were set on fire. Gunshots were also heard in Delmas 31 road. Clashes also occurred in the Fort National and Solino neighborhoods (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 14 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, unidentified gang members attacked the population by breaking into people's homes and setting fire to their houses. Casualties unknown.

On 13 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, Belair gang members attacked residents in the Fort National neighbourhood, shooting and killing at least two civilians and injuring several others. Several houses were set on fire. The attack was part of an offensive aiming at taking control of the neighbourhood. The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led alliance. Gunshots were heard in the Solino neighbourhood. At least 2 fatalities, several injured.

On 13 May 2024, near Dessalines, Artibonite, the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped a peace judge man in the Estere commune and a lawyer man when they were riding a motorcycle along the Mapou Road (in Marchand Dessalines) on their way home. Both men were killed. The judge's corpse was found a day later in a forested area in Lacroix-Perisse. 2 fatalities.

On 13 May 2024, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, in the morning, a group of individuals held a demonstration at the customs office to decry high clearance costs and against the sending of a commission in charge of strengthening the customs' control capacities. Demonstrators blocked access to the office and threatened employees and the members of the mentioned commission. Overnight, the rioters set fire to the customs main barrier.

On 13 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, armed gang members shot and killed a police officer man in the Cote Plage neighbourhood and took his body to an unknown location. Several sources stated that the dead officer was a former member of the so called 'Caravane Group' and that the attack was in reprisal for having left the organization. The 'Caravane Group' was described as integrated by police officers aiming at fighting gang violence. Some of its members were said to have joined the gangsters. 1 fatality.

On 12 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members on the Anglade street, in the Solino neighbourhood, as they intervened to expel the criminals from the area. Two teenager boys were shot and killed, while several civilians were injured. The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang). 2 fatalities, several injured.

Around 11 May 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, unidentified gang members attacked the population. They set fire to residents' houses who were forced to flee their homes. There is no further information on the nature of the attacks. They also attacked the police station while trying to take over the area (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 10 May 2024, in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, overnight, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang clashed with affiliates of the Jean-Denis Gang as the first ones occupied the National Road 1 and attacked residents in Pont Sonde and in nearby Moreau Paye area. Two civilians were killed and a Jean-Denis Gang member was injured. Several residents were abducted. The victims' whereabouts are unknown. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.
On 10 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed members of the Living Together gang-led alliance attacked the Solino neighbourhood and nearby areas. Casualties unknown.

Around 10 May 2024 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, gang members abducted an unknown number of truck drivers working for the Tabarre city hall, in the Truitier neighbourhood. Their whereabouts are unknown.

On 10 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, overnight, armed members of the Grand-Ravine Gang set fire to the Gressier police station, in Cite Gressier neighbourhood. A police vehicle, the houses of an assessor mayor, and a police responsible, as well as a school building were also burned. Police forces intervened and clashed with the gang members in the vicinity of the police station, although they were unable to expel the criminals, who took control of the facility. A police officer was shot and injured. A public transport driver and several civilians were wounded by the bullets. Several women were raped at their homes. Thousands of residents fled their homes to take refuge elsewhere. The gang members are part of the Living Together gang-led initiative. During the offensive, which last until 11 May, several of them were recorded expressing their rejection to the Multilateral Support Security Mission (MMSS). On 12 May, police forces, supported by the Miragoane police commissioner, and BSAP agents, regained control of the police station after the gang members had abandoned it. At least 2 injured.

On 9 May 2024, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang killed two people and abducted three others. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. Moments after the attack, one of the gangsters was lynched by a mob of residents (coded separately). 2 fatalities.

On 9 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, employees of the commune's city hall held a demonstration outside the institution to demand the payment of due salaries. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires on the Gregoire Street, in the Centre Ville (Sud) neighbourhood.

On 9 May 2024, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, a mob of residents lynched a member of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. The attack was a reprisal for the killing of two people and the abduction of three others moments before (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 8 May 2024 (as reported), in Gonaives, Artibonite, at least two men abducted a 19-year-old woman and raped her. The perpetrators asked for a ransom of 200,000 dollars as a condition for the release of the victim. It is known that the family already paid 50,000 dollars. The two abductors were arrested by the police on 8 May, although the victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 8 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, armed gang members shot and killed a police officer woman as she tried to resist a kidnapping attempt, on the Camille Leon Street (in Bois Verna neighbourhood). The attack took place moments after the officer had left her girl at school (likely off-duty). The attackers stole the officer's firearm and fled the scene on a motorcycle. 1 fatality.

On 7 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed individuals in a police armored tank opened fire on a public transport minibus with 80 passengers on board, in the Martissant neighbourhood. Four people were killed and several others were injured. The attackers were thought to be Ti Bwa gang members, as the armored tank was identified as a stolen vehicle by members of this gang on 12 October 2022 (coded separately). 4 fatalities, several injured.

On 7 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two gang members during an intervention to thwart a kidnapping attempt on the Marcelin street (Bas Peu de Choses neighbourhood). The intended victim of the abduction was rescued by the police. The gangsters travelled in a vehicle with no plate. The deceased's accomplices managed to run away. 2 fatalities.
Around 6 May 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, gang members attacked the Clercine neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.
Around 5 May 2024 (weekend of), in Mariani, Ouest, police forces shot and killed the leader of a gang from Mariani during clashes in the area. 1 fatality.

On 5 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang), led by the G-9, shot and injured a national police officer in the Solino neighbourhood. 1 injured.
On 3 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, gang members attacked residential areas in the commune, forcing thousands of families to flee their homes. Casualties unknown.

On 3 May 2024, Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, armed men on a motorcycle killed a man near Saint Pierre Square (Centre Ville (Sud) neighborhood) (drive-by). There is no information on the motives of the attack. 1 fatality.

On 3 May 2024, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, overnight, the 37 prisoners of a cell rioted at the Civil Prison in an escape attempt. According to the officers, as an inmate who pretended to feel unwell refused to go back to his cell, other inmates took advantage of the situation and attacked a prison guard, forced the gate, and escaped. Other prison guards intervened and shot and killed at least four rioters (up to nine according to BINUH). There were 15 injured among prisoners and security guards. Eight inmates managed to escape (up to 30 according to other sources). Two officers were arrested on suspicion of having facilitated the riot. At least 4 fatalities, 15 injured.

On 2 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, gang members assaulted the Solino and Nazon neighborhoods and burned some residents' houses. Police forces intervened and clashed with the gangsters, who seemed to be affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang). Clashes between police forces and gang members were also mentioned near the National Palace (in Champs de Mars). Gunshots were heard throughout the day and overnight in the area, as well as in Christ-Roi. Some residents fled their homes. Casualties unknown.

On 2 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, gang members assaulted Delmas 18 and Delmas 22 (in Cite Numero Un neighborhood), and Delmas 24 (in Delmas 28 neighborhood). Some residents' houses were burned. Police forces intervened and clashed with gangsters, who seemed to be affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang). Gunshots were heard throughout the day and overnight in the area, as well as in Siloe, Delmas 33, and Catalpa. Some residents fled their homes. Casualties unknown.

On 2 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, armed individuals clashed with officers from the Motorized Response Brigade (BIM). Gunshots were registered near the airport (coded to Mais Gate/Clercine 2). There is no information on the circumstances of the clash. Casualties unknown.

Around 1 May 2024 (as reported), in Santo, Ouest, gang members attacked disabled people from the Foyer Saint-Vincent in Santo 17. The report indicates that the people have had to evacuate the premises towards other refuges. There is no further information on the nature of the attack.

On 1 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, members of the Living-Together gang-led initiative (coded separately), led by the G-9 Gang, attacked the Solino and Nazon neighborhoods and burned residents' houses. Police forces were deployed and clashed with the criminals. There were several injured by the gunshots (affiliation unknown). Gunshots were heard throughout the day and overnight. Some residents fled their homes. According to one source, the criminals were members of the Bel Air Gang, although this was not confirmed by other sources. Several injured.

On 1 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, members of the Living-Together gang-led initiative (coded separately), led by the G-9 Gang, attacked Bas Delmas, Delmas 18 (in Cite Numero Un neighbourhood), and Delmas 24 (in Delmas 28 neighbourhood). Some residents' houses were burned. Police forces were deployed and clashed with the criminals. There were several injured by the gunshots (affiliation unknown). Gunshots were heard throughout the day and overnight. According to one source, the criminals were members of the Bel Air Gang, although this was not confirmed by other sources. Casualties unknown.

On 1 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, overnight, gang members attacked the Toussaint Louverture Airport facilities, in the Mais Gate neighborhood, and clashed with police and military forces, who intervened and expelled them from the area. Gunshots were also heard in Tabarre 27. Casualties unknown.
On 30 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members set fire to residents' houses in Bas Delmas. Gunshots were heard in the area. Casualties unknown.

On 30 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, Bout Ba gang members hijacked some boats in the port in Mon Repos neighborhood while they were going to Cayemites island. They also kidnapped the owners of the boats. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 29 April 2024 (week of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed gang members attacked the Foyer Saint-Vincent facilities, located on the Paul VI street, near Champs de Mars neighbourhood. An unknown number of disabled people (mostly children) were forced to flee the building. Casualties unknown.

Around 29 April 2024 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) attacked a residential neighbourhood near the US Embassy (in Chateau Blond neighbourhood), forcing more than 150 civilians to flee their homes. According to a witness, a man was shot and killed. 1 fatality.

On 28 April 2024, in Hinche, Centre, in the morning, a group of inmates, armed with white weapons, rioted at the Hinche jail as part of an escape attempt. Prison guards, supported by a National Police Special Unit, intervened and clashed with the prisoners for several hours. Two inmates were shot and killed, while at least seven others and three police officers were injured. The riot took place two days after the prison agents decided not to receive food for the prisoners, who engaged in a strike movement to demand proper treatment. 2 fatalities, at least 10 injured.

On 25 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police and military forces clashed with gang members near the National Palace (in Champs de Mars neighbourhood), where a ceremony was being held for the installation of a National Transitional Council -TPC- (coded separately). During clashes, at least three people were killed and several others were injured (affiliation unspecified). At least two of the injured were military officers who got shot on the Saint-Honore street (Champs de Mars). The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang). They had claimed to oppose the installation of the TPC. The gang members occupied the Nazon Road and gunshots were heard in the nearby Bel Air neighbourhood. At least 3 fatalities, at least 2 injured.

On 25 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members on Delmas 24 street as the criminals attacked and set fire to at least eight residents' houses there and in nearby Delmas 28 and Delmas 30 neighborhoods. During clashes, an unspecified number of gang members were killed and at least 10 civilians were injured by the gunshots. A civilian who was injured claimed to have been shot by police forces. This happened while a ceremony was being held for the installation of a National Transitional Council -TPC-, in Port-au-Prince commune (coded separately). The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang). They had claimed to oppose the installation of the TPC. Gunshots were also heard in Carrefour Aeroport and Carrefour Drouillard. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, at least 10 injured.

On 24 April 2024, in Arcahaie, Ouest, in the morning, armed gang members 'attacked' the Public Market and caused panic among civilians and traders, who fled the market. A video showed the gangsters taking away a quantity of sacks. According to witnesses, they left the area with a rowboat. Casualties unknown.

On 24 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in the Champs de Mars neighbourhood. The officers fired tear gas in the vicinity of the National Palace to disperse those individuals approaching the area. Gunshots were also heard near the Sylvio Cator Stadium (Morne a Tuf neighborhood). There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots. Casualties unknown.

On 23 April 2024, in Pilate, Nord, in the morning, an unknown number of armed individuals shot and killed a peace judge man as they opened fire on the motorcycle he was travelling on between the Palan and Nan Siklet localities. The judge was being driven to the Pilate Peace Court (workplace) when the attack took place. There is no information on the driver's health state. 1 fatality.

On 23 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, an unknown number of armed individuals attacked the head of the Jean-Jacques Dessalines high school on the Christophe Avenue (in Bas Peu de Choses neighbourhood). The victim was injured to the head (nature of the wounds unspecified). The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 injured.

On 22 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for a second consecutive day, police forces clashed with gang members in the vicinity of the National Palace, in Champs de Mars neighbourhood. Gunshots were heard near the Faculty of Medicine and Pharmacy of the UEH University and near the Haiti State University Hospital (HUEH) (a.k.a. Port-au-Prince General Hospital), in Champs de Mars neighbourhood too. The gang offensive was described as an attempt to take control of the National Palace to prevent the installation of the Presidential Transitional Council. Casualties unknown.

On 21 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police and military forces clashed with gang members in the vicinity of the National Palace (Champs de Mars neighbourhood) and in nearby Lalue and Bois Verna neighborhoods. During clashes, several people were shot and injured by the stray bullets near the Ministry of Culture and Communications (Pacot neighbourhood). The gang offensive was described as an attempt to prevent the installation of a Presidential Transitional Council. One source suggested that the criminals were affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang). Gunshots were also heard in La Saline neighborhood and in in Waaf Jeremie neighborhood (Cite Soleil). Several injured.

On 21 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, in the morning, police forces shot and killed at least five members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) and injured several others. At least 5 fatalities, several injured.

On 21 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members clashed with police forces as they looted and set fire to houses in Bas Delmas, in Delmas 19, and in Carrefour Aeroport neighborhoods. One source suggested that the criminals were affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang). Gunshots were also heard in Delmas 32. Casualties unknown.

On 20 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, gang members looted and vandalized the Faculty of Medicine and Pharmacy of the UEH University, located on the Mgr Guilloux street (Champs de Mars neighbourhood). The criminals looted the faculty's cafe, stole a bus, solar panels, and medical items. During the gang assault, which aimed at using the university's facility as base to confront police forces, a person was shot and killed in nearby Capois street (Bas Peu de Choses neighbourhood). Looting scenes at the faculty persisted at least until 21 April. The perpetrators were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led initiative (Viv Ansanm gang). 1 fatality.

Around 18 April 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, members of the Ti Bwa Gang clashed with affiliates of a local gang operating in the Lambi area. Clashes took place as the Ti Bwa Gang attacked the local gang's positions to remove gang roadblocks set up in the area. Casualties unknown.

On 18 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, more than 200 Ti Bwa gang members attacked the Mon Repos and Waney Bijou neighborhoods as they carried out an offensive aiming at and taking control of the commune. Seven civilians and a police officer were killed as the gangsters opened fire in the Waney 93 area. There were several injured by gunshots. The criminals assaulted the Omega police station (in Bas Thorland neighbourhood) and released the prisoners. Weapons and materials belonging to the police were stolen. Two officers who were present were forced to leave. Another version stated that they were kidnapped and released moments later in Bizoton. Clashes between the gangsters and the police were mentioned. The gangsters forced drivers to stop their march in the Brochette and Lamentin neighborhoods, among others. One source stated that the offensive aimed at establishing a new gang leader in the Cote Plage neighbourhood. 8 fatalities, several injured.

On 18 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, police forces in an armoured vehicle shot and injured a civilian man while he was collecting wood in an area under the control of the gangs. 1 injured.

On 17 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two individuals who tried to avoid a police checkpoint. A third one managed to escape. The victims were described as suspected gang members. 2 fatalities.

On 15 April 2024, in Mirebalais, Centre, in the morning, members of the population killed an individual (methods unknown) and burned his body. The victim had a firearm and ammunition in his possession. The motivation for the attack was not clarified, although it is suspected to be a case of vigilante justice. 1 fatality.

On 15 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two men in Delmas 75 neighbourhood. It happened as the victims, who were riding a motorcycle, tried to flee a police checkpoint on the street. 2 fatalities.

On 14 April 2024, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Savien Gang attacked the Savane Pistache locality. According to the report, more than five people were wounded during the attack, while three residents were abducted. The victims' whereabouts are unknown. At least 5 injured.
On 14 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, in the morning, members of vigilante brigades killed a member of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang). 1 fatality.

On 14 April 2024, in Arcahaie, Ouest, unidentified gang members hijacked a truck transporting rice towards la Gonave. The hijackers kidnapped the six members of the transportation crew. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 14 April 2024 (weekend of), near Gros-Morne, Artibonite, an unknown number of individuals perpetrated several kidnappings on the road leading to the Tibwadom locality. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 13 April 2024, off the Coast of Lafiteau, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men hijacked a rice cargo ship at the height of the Flour Mill (Lafiteau) which destination was La Gonave island. Six on-board occupants were kidnapped while 1,500 rice sacks were stolen. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 12 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members shot and killed a police officer on the Toussaint Louverture Boulevard, a.k.a. the Airport Road (in Carrefour Drouillard neighbourhood). The attack took place as he was coming back from a relative's house (coded as off-duty). 1 fatality.

On 10 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with armed group members in the vicinity of the Haiti State University Hospital, in the Champs de Mars neighbourhood. During clashes, a health worker was killed as he attended the facilities of the hospital. 1 fatality.

On 9 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed gang members assaulted a journalist man and stole him a motorcycle, money, and a telephone. No further details were mentioned. There were no fatalities.

On 8 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in the vicinity of the National Palace (Champs de Mars neighbourhood) as the gangsters attacked civilian facilities in the area and around, including the Bird School (on the Enterrement street). Material damages were mentioned at the school. Police forces used megaphones to inform citizens to leave the area. Gunshots were heard throughout the day in Nazon and Lalue neighborhoods, as well as in other areas such as Alerte street (Bas Peu de Choses neighborhood), Sylvio Cator Stadium (Morne a Tuf neighborhood), Marche Salomon (Turgeau neighborhood), Bolosse Avenue (Martissant neighborhood). Casualties unknown.

On 6 April 2024, off the Coast of Port-au-Prince, Ouest, coast guards and police forces clashed with members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) and with affiliates of the Canaan Gang as they carried out a security operation aiming at recovering a cargo ship which had been hijacked by the gangsters on 4 April (coded separately). During clashes, two police officers were injured while several gang members were killed. The rice cargo was recovered. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 5 April 2024, in Drouet, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed nine people, injured eight others, and abducted 10 as they perpetrated an attack on the main road leading to Liancourt. The whereabouts of the abducted are unknown. The official version had stated that the fatal victims were four, the injured were six, and the kidnapped five, although several photos shared on social media by local sources confirmed the other balance. 9 fatalities, 8 injured.

On 5 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, a lynching was carried out against an alleged thief in Delmas 103 (Morne Hercule neighborhood) on the Delmas Road. His body was burned. There is no information on the perpetrators or circumstances of the lynching. 1 fatality.

On 5 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, unidentified individuals looted and set fire to the house of a former deputy, located on the Enterrement street (Morne a Tuf neighbourhood). Casualties unknown.

On 4 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped a man and his wife. He was said to be a known meteorologist. The woman was released on the same day of the kidnapping, while he remained captive until 8 April. His release happened under unknown circumstances. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related.

On 4 April 2024, off the Coast of Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang), together with affiliates of the Taliban Gang, abducted the occupants of a cargo ship known as 'Magalie' and hijacked 10,000 sacks of rice as the vessel was leaving the Varreux Terminal (La Saline neighbourhood) with Cap-Haitien as its destination. The cargo was recovered by police forces on 6 April (coded separately). The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

Around 3 April 2024 (between 3 - 4 April), in Verrettes, Artibonite, heavily armed individuals kidnapped four people in the Savari locality (Verrettes). Two of the victims were two lawyer men who were killed by the abductors. The other two victims were released without ransom. The deceased bodies were found the next day in an area known as 'Savann papiyon' (Liancourt). Preliminary versions stated that the kidnappers were members of the Savien Gang, although latest reports claimed that the attack was perpetrated by members of a self-defense group. The motivation is suspected to be a settlement of scores. 2 fatalities.

On 2 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in the vicinity of the National Palace as these ones opened fire on the institution (in Champs de Mars neighbourhood). A number of gangsters entered the premises of the Haiti State University Hospital (HUEH) (a.k.a. Port-au-Prince General Hospital), located near Morne a Tuf neighbourhood, and shot at the officers from the hospital's facilities. Smoke rose from the Finance Ministry building (Champs de Mars). Police forces fired tear gas to disperse the scores of civilians who were nearby. During clashes, a man was shot and killed by a stray bullet in front of the Blaise Pascal School, in Lalue neighbourhood. The victim was a moto taxi driver. Gunshots were also heard in Christ-Roi. The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led coalition (Viv Ansanm gang). 1 fatality.

On 2 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, overnight, gang members tried to enter the Delmas Peace Court building (in Carrefour Aeroport). Police forces intervened and prevented it. Gunshots were heard in nearby Delmas 30 and 28 (Delmas - Carrefour Aeroport). Casualties unknown.

On 2 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) in the Meyotte neighbourhood. Several firearms and ammunition were seized. Casualties unknown.

On 2 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gang leader during a security operation in the Meyotte neighbourhood. The victim was described as the leader of a gang from Cite Doudoune (in Croix-des-Bouquets). 1 fatality.

On 2 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Chien Mechant Gang as they intervened to expel them from the vicinity of the BIM police station (in Carrefour Clercine neighbourhood). In reprisal, the gangsters looted scores of houses and stole at least five vehicles in the Village Theodat and Tercina residential areas (Carrefour Clercine). Residents were forced to flee. Gunshots were also heard in Cite Doudoune near Tabarre 27 (Carrefour Fleuriot neighborhood). Casualties unknown.

On 1 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, gang members attacked the Carrefour Clercine neighbourhood. No further details were mentioned. Another report indicates that there were clashes near the Comme Il Faut premises. Gunshots were also heard in other neighborhoods, such as Butte Boyer, Croix des Missions, Village Thomas Theodat, and Cazeau, as well as near the police station and city hall. Casualties unknown.

On 1 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police and military forces clashed with the Base 5 Secondes Gang near the National Palace (in Champs de Mars neighbourhood). During clashes, the gang members set fire to a police armored vehicle on the Monseigneur Guilloux street (Morne a Tuf neighbourhood), injuring at least four officers who were inside. Scores of civilians got trapped amidst the crossfire. A person whose body was found on the street with gunshot wounds was likely to have been killed in the crossfire. The armed gangsters looted and robbed the National Library (near Champs de Mars). They also entered the Saint-Martial Minor Seminary School (Champs de Mars), burned several vehicles and destroyed some materials, although no casualties among the present colleagues were mentioned. Gunshots were heard on Lamarre street (Champs de Mars) and on Capois street (near Bois Verna), as well as in Christ-Roi coming from Nazon. The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led coalition led by the G-9 Gang. At least 1 fatality, at least 4 injured.

On 1 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces in an armored vehicle clashed with gang members in Bas Delmas as part of efforts to expel the criminals from the area. A man was shot and killed in Delmas 30 as gunshots were heard in this area, and in Toussaint Louverture Boulevard (near Carrefour Drouillard), as well as in Carrefour Drouillard. 1 fatality.

On 1 April 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed at least four members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) during clashes in the Meyotte neighbourhood. Gunshots were heard in Freres, Vivy Mitchell, Corlette (Meyotte), Metivier, and Doco areas. At least 4 fatalities.

On 31 March 2024, in L'Estere, Artibonite, overnight, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang as they set fire to a private vehicle, several houses, a mill, and a rice warehouse in the commune. During the attack there was an exchange of shots ( unknown with whom) and two gang members were shot and killed. 2 fatalities.

On 30 March 2024, in Belladere, Centre, a mob of residents killed a man who was described as a prisoner who had escaped jail after gang members assaulted the two major Haitian prisons on 2 March (coded separately). He had been involved in the killing of a police officer. 1 fatality.

On 29 March 2024, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, armed gang members occupied and set fire to several buildings at the Digneron Industrial Park, including a 96,000 square foot warehouse containing raw materials. Industrial machines and offices were destroyed. Casualties unknown.

On 29 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) entered the Vincent Gymnasium facilities (near Bois Verna neighbourhood), kidnapped two girls, and raped them. The victims were part of residents who had fled their homes and had taken refuge at the gymnasium.

On 29 March 2024, in Mirebalais, Centre, a mob of dozens of residents lynched and burned alive two arrested men who were in custody at a police station in the Desvarieux residential area. One of the victims was a police officer. The other was a former employee of the Provisional Electoral Council (CEP). The mobsters identified them as gang members after both men had been arrested for trafficking of ammunition. Police forces fired shots into the air to prevent the attack, with no success. It was described as a case of vigilante justice by affiliates of the Bwa Kale movement. 2 fatalities.

On 29 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed an unspecified number of gang members near the National Palace (Champs de Mars neighbourhood). The deceased were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led coalition (Viv Ansanm gang). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 28 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed gang members killed the accountant of the Office of the Secretary of State for Literacy as they opened fire on the vehicle he was travelling in with his wife, on the Capois street (near Bois Verna). There is no information on the wife's health state. The perpetrators were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang-led coalition (aka Viv Ansanm gang). 1 fatality.

On 27 March 2024, in Anse-d'Hainault commune, Grande-Anse, in the morning, masked armed pirates kidnapped a fisher and stole a dozen rowboat engines during an attack against Les Irois and Anse-d'Hainault communes. The victim's whereabouts are unknown. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related.

On 27 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members set fire to the Superior Normal School (ENS) facilities, in Canape-Vert neighbourhood. It is known that the building was unoccupied when the attack took place. One the same day, an unspecified number of dead bodies were found on nearby streets after the gang members entered the neighbourhood. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 27 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, the police clashed with gang members in Freres neighborhood. Gunshots were heard in the area. A driver died as result of the incident. Gunshots of unspecified authorship were also heard in Puits Blain 4 neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 27 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, the police clashed with members of the Chien Mechant Gang in Clercine neighborhood. According to the source the gang started attacking and looting police bases in the area in response to the police announcing the destruction of about a hundred houses located next to the international airport. This resulted in clashes between the two parties. Casualties unknown.

On 26 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, seven members of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) were shot and killed amidst armed clashes with police forces on the Freres Road (Freres neighbourhood). 7 fatalities.

On 26 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, overnight, the police clashed with members of the Chien Mechant Gang in Clercine neighborhood. According to the source the gang started attacking and looting police bases in the area in response to the police announcing the destruction of about a hundred houses located next to the international airport. This resulted in clashes between the two parties. Gunshots were still being heard in the area the following day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 25 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members attacked, looted, and set fire to several buildings on the Monseigneur Guilloux street (Morne a Tuf neighbourhood), including at least five pharmacies, several private clinics, an unspecified number of private residences, business establishments, and several vehicles. The National School of Arts was looted and some works were stolen. The Freres Nau Mixed School, located on the Centre street (Champs de Mars), was also burned. At least one person was killed. His/her dead body was found lying on the street. At least 1 fatality.

On 25 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, in the morning, armed gang members shot and killed a police officer and injured two others as they opened fire on a private vehicle they were moving in, in Carrefour Vincent (Sarthe neighbourhood). 1 fatality, 2 injured.

On 25 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Croix des Missions. The officers were ambushed as they intervened to clear the Rails Road. Clashes between the police and gang members were also registered in Cazeau. Gunshots were heard in Butte Boyer and Carrefour Clercine zones. Casualties unknown.

On 24 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, gang members perpetrated an attack on the Reunion and Enterrement streets (near Champs de Mars) and set fire to vehicles inside an open-air garage, to houses, business establishments, and goods. A Peace Court was burned. In Village de Dieu (Cite de Dieu neighbourhood), gang members opened fire on a helicopter flying over the South of the capital. Casualties unknown.

On 24 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, gunshots were heard in Carrefour Vincent (Sarthe neighbourhood). The gunshots are suspected to be the result of clashes between the police and unidentified armed individuals. Casualties unknown.

On 23 March 2024, in Vivier, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals kidnapped a man at his home, in Lilavois 23. The man was a musician at a Baptist Church. There is no information on the perpetrators although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 23 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, a person was killed in Delmas 31 (Maguana neighborhood) and gunshots were heard in Delmas 19, as well as in Delmas 3 (Delmas 5 neighborhood) and near Village Solidarite. Though the perpetrators remain unknown, both events happened amidst gang violence taking place in the area. 1 fatality.

On 23 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, police forces clashed with gang members as they intervened to expel the criminals from the Departmental Operation and Intervention Brigade (BOID) facilities, located in the Fort National neighbourhood. The gangsters set fire to several vehicles and houses in the area. Several corpses were found scattered on Martin Luther King and Poupelard streets (Nazon), in Bois Verna, Champs de Mars, and Jeremie square (Bas Peu de Choses). Gunshots were heard in Christ-Roi and Canape-Vert. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members as they intervened to expel the criminals from the vicinity of the Motorized Intervention Brigade's facilities (BIM), and from the Tabarre police station (both in Carrefour Clercine neighbourhood). The police station had been shot by the gangsters moments before. According to residents, the gangsters tried to take control of an Armed Forces' antenna, and of the Headquarters of the General Directorate of the National Police of Haiti, near the International Airport (in Tabarre 14). Gunshots were heard in Butte Boyer. The gang members were described as affiliates of the Living Together gang initiative (Viv Asanm). Casualties unknown.

On 22 March 2024, in Mariani, Ouest, a renowned gang member of the Bout Ba gang was killed. A report indicates that he was killed by people close to him, while another indicates that another leader of the Bout Ba gang ordered the killing following an argument between the two. 1 fatality.

On 22 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Delmas 60. Around 10 bodies were found scattered in Delmas and Petionville. Some of them were burned. At least 10 fatalities split across two events.

On 22 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in Delmas 95. Around 10 bodies were found scattered in Delmas and Petionville. Some of them were burned. At least 10 fatalities split across two events.

On 21 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members on the Saint-Honore street as they tried to repel a gang attack against the National Palace (Champs de Mars neighbourhood). Several gang members were killed. A civilian got a leg shot and injured. He was assisted by security forces. Gunshots were heard near the general hospital, the National Palace, the National Penitentiary (Champs de Mars), and in Poste Marchand, where a young man was hit by a stray bullet while at home. He died later in hospital. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 21 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members near the headquarters of the Intervention and Order Maintenance Corps (CIMO), located in Cite Numero Un neighbourhood. In nearby Delmas 19 (Cite Numero Un), a journalist man was shot and injured by the stray bullets. He died on 24 March. 1 fatality.

On 21 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Delmas 95 Gang and two accomplices during a clash in Delmas 66 (near Morne Hercule). A photo of the gang leader's dead body was shared on social media. One source stated that the deceased was decapitated and then burned (likely by a mob of residents). His killing took place three weeks after he had escaped from the National Penitentiary following a gang assault against the prison's facilities on 2 March (coded separately). Gunshots were heard in the commune. 3 fatalities.
On 20 March 2024, in Lascahobas, Centre, a mob of residents killed an arrested man and suspected member of the 400 Mawozo Gang. The mobsters grabbed him by force from a police vehicle. 1 fatality.

On 20 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, employees of the Ministry of Public Works demonstrated by erecting burning tires in front of the institution. There is no information on the motives of the demonstration.

On 20 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, a person was shot and killed in Delmas 40 B. There is no information on the perpetrators, though reports suggest that this attack is related to gang violence and to clashes recorded in this same area (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 20 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, suspected members of the Bwa Kale movement lynched at least four Mackandal gang members and in Demas 95 and 97. This happened amid clashes between police forces and gang members (coded separately). At least 4 fatalities.

On 20 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the morning, police forces shot and killed three gang members as they intervened to repel gang attacks in Delmas 40 B and on Reinbold Street (Bourdon neighbourhood). As the officers moved in a police patrol, gangsters moving in two vehicles and opened fire on them, leading to a clash as they returned fire (drive-by). The gangs' vehicles were seized. 3 fatalities.

On 20 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Mackandal Gang and at least two accomplices as they intervened to repeal gang attacks against the population in Demas 95 and 97 (Jacquet neighbourhood). Gunshots were heard along the Corlette Road (Peguy-Ville), Delmas 95, and Pernier neighbourhood as members of the Vitelhomme Gang (Kraze Barye Gang) were seen circulating through the streets. Also, gunshots were heard near the Police Academy . There is no information on the circumstances or authorship of the gunshots. According to residents, more than 10 gangsters were killed on 20 March. A number of them were killed by mobs of residents (coded separately). At least 3 fatalities.

On 20 March 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members shot and killed a police officer in Delmas 72 area (Delmas 17 neighborhood). The affiliation of the perpetrators was not clarified, although the killing was described as a gang reprisal for a previous police intervention against the G-9 Gang fief in Delmas 6 (coded separately). 1 fatality.
