Between 13 and 16 November, ReliefWeb reported the burning of houses, the rape of women (coded separately), and at least 166 fatalities amidst clashes. At least 166 fatalities split across six clashes reported in Cite-Soleil between 13 and 16 November.

Around 15 November 2023 (between 13 - 17 November), in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, members of the G-9 Gang raped at least five women in the Terre Noire neighbourhood. This happened as the G-9 gangsters engaged in armed clashes with the G-Pep La Gang in the commune between 13 and 17 November (coded separately).

On 14 November 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets commune, Ouest, unidentified gang members fired shots and set up (narco) roadblocks with barricades in several neighborhoods of La Plaine du Cul de Sac. It happened as rival gangsters engaged in clashes to fight for territory after the leader of the Belekou Gang (and G-9 affiliate), who used to control the area, died on 12 November (coded separately). An unknown number of civilians and gangsters were killed and injured. Some families fled the area. Unspecified fatalities coded as 3.

Around 14 November 2023 (as reported), in Tiburon, Sud, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped a business man and killed him after several days in captivity despite the payment of a ransom of 500,000 gourdes by the victim's family. 1 fatality.

On 14 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, members of the G-9 Gang coalition engaged in armed clashes with the G-Pep La Gang as they fought to replace the Belekou Gang leader (and G-9 affiliate), who used to control the area and died on 12 November (coded separately). Barricades were set up by the gangsters. At least 12 individuals among civilians and gang members were killed on this day. Others were injured. Between 13 and 16 November, ReliefWeb reported the burning of houses, the rape of women, and at least 166 fatalities amidst clashes. At least 166 fatalities split across six clashes reported in Cite-Soleil between 13 and 16 November.

Around 14 November 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, unidentified gang members from Terre Noire clashed with the Chien Mechant Gang as they fought to replace the Belekou Gang leader (and G-9 Gang affiliate), who used to control the area and died on 12 November (coded separately). The members of both gangs were described as allies of the deceased Belekou Gang leader, and as rival organizations between them over to the killing of a gangster (no further details mentioned on this). Between 13 and 16 November, ReliefWeb reported the burning of houses, the rape of women, and at least 166 fatalities amidst clashes. At least 166 fatalities split across six clashes reported in Cite-Soleil between 13 and 16 November.

On 13 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, members of the G-9 Gang coalition, supported by the Belekou Gang, engaged in armed clashes with the G-Pep La Gang as they fought to replace the Belekou Gang leader (and G-9 affiliate), who used to control the area and died the day prior (coded separately). One source stated that the Belekou Gang managed to repeal rival gangsters. An unknown number of civilians and gangsters were killed and injured. Between 13 and 16 November, ReliefWeb reported the burning of houses, the rape of women, and at least 166 fatalities amidst clashes. At least 166 fatalities split across six clashes reported in Cite-Soleil between 13 and 16 November.

On 12 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men shot and killed a police officer between Gerald Bataille and Delmas 33 neighborhoods. No further details on the circumstances of the attack were mentioned. 1 fatality.

On 11 November 2023, in Gros-Morne, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped 17 passengers from a bus in the Tibwadom locality while they were being transported from the capital to Port-de-Paix. A ransom of 500.000 gourdes has been requested in exchange for their release. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 10 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, the Belekou Gang leader (and G-9 Gang coalition affiliate) was shot. His health state after the attack and the identity of the perpetrators were not clarified. He died two days later as he committed suicide under unclarified circumstances (coded separately). There were no fatalities.

On 9 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed gang members kidnapped two employees of the Bank of the Republic of Haiti and an employee of the National Bank of Credit on the Pavee Street. The abductions took place when the victims were about to arrive to their workplaces. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 9 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, an abduction was registered near the Office of Vehicle Insurance Against Third Parties (OAVCT). There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the kidnapping. However, latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim(s)' whereabouts are unknown.

On 9 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, overnight, an armed man opened fire on the house of a judge, in Delmas 75. The shooter was said to be a police officer. The motivation was not clarified, although the judge had been in charge of an investigation related to the killing of a journalist (coded separately). The attack is not ruled out to be linked to his role in that case. There were no casualties.

Around 8 November 2023 (week of), near Quatrieme Puilboreau, Artibonite, several armed men attacked tanker drivers and road users on the National Road 1. A civilian was shot and injured, while several vehicles were hijacked and looted. This was attributed to members of a new gang operating in the zone. 1 injured.

On 7 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men in a vehicle with no license plate shot and killed at least five people and injured several others near Carrefour Fleuriot (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. At least 5 fatalities, several injured.

On 7 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed gang members killed a man who had been sent as messenger to submit a ransom asked by the kidnappers of a former minister and member of the High Transitional Council for elections (HCT) and his driver, who were abducted on 18 October (coded separately). The gangsters burned the man's body. The attack, that was recorded on video, was a reprisal for submitting a ransom under the amount of money that had been agreed. 1 fatality.

On 7 November 2023, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, tens of residents at the border held a demonstration against the presence of Dominican soldiers at the Haitian-Dominican border after some military were deployed in the area (coded separately). During the demonstration, rioters set up barricades of burning tires, dug a ditch at a cross point, and beat up the departmental head of the Protected Areas of Surveillance Brigade (BSAP) as he intervened to prevent the rioters from throwing stones at the soldiers. Police forces intervened (methods unknown) and prevented the BSAP member from being wounded. The Dominican soldiers tried to remove the barricades and pointed at the rioters with their firearms. The rioters accused the soldiers of entering the Haitian territory, while the Dominican presidency spokesperson claimed that it was the Haitian rioters who entered the Dominican territory due to a misunderstanding of the boundaries of the border. This happened amidst tensions between both countries over the construction of a canal around the Massacre River (coded separately).

On 6 November 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, several members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang moving in three vehicle opened fire on a crowd and fired indiscriminately, killing at least a man and injuring several civilians (drive-by). The attack was described as a show of force aiming at sending a message to a rival armed group operating in a nearby village. The fatal victim was a teacher. At least 1 fatality, several injured.

On 6 November 2023, in Terrier Rouge, Nord-Est, residents and clients held a demonstration to decry the management of the National Rural Electric Cooperative Association (NRECA) US power entity. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires in front of the company's office and blocked the National Road 6 as they demanded the company to review its electricity distribution schedule after having changed it due to a fuel crisis.

On 6 November 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked residents as they set fire to around 10 houses. Several people were kidnapped. Their whereabouts are unknown. Casualties unknown.

On 6 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, at least seven armed men moving in two vehicles, several of them wearing police uniforms, kidnapped a man as they forced him to exit his vehicle when leaving his residence, in Puits Blanc 32, and took him with them. Several other civilians were kidnapped in Delmas 33. A police intervention moments later thwarted the abductions (coded separately). There is no further information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related.
On 6 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, an episode of lynching was registered in Delmas 97. There is no further information on the circumstances of the incident. Casualties unknown.

On 6 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang shot and killed a 10-year-old boy in the Mariani neighbourhood. The minor had been interrogated and accused of being a police informant. 1 fatality.

On 6 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men kidnapped five public lawyers and employees of the Superior Court of Accounts and Administrative Litigation (CSCCA), in Laboule 12. Among the abducted, they are the Head of Human Resources and the Head of the Court. It happened when the victims were on their way to work. The victims were released around 23 November after a ransom of unknown nature was paid.

On 6 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces shot and killed at least nine armed men during a clash in Delmas 33. It happened as security forces intervened to release a man who had been kidnapped in Puits Blanc 32, moments before, and several other people abducted in Delmas 33 (coded separately). These kidnappings were thwarted as police forces neutralized the abductors. According to the officers, the armed men travelled in two vehicles and several were dressed police uniforms. Several armed men were arrested and some weapons were seized. Another report indicates that two police officers were arrested in connection to the incident. At least 9 fatalities.

On 6 November 2023, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, overnight, unidentified individuals vandalized and set fire to the barrier of the customs office of Cap-Haitien. The attack seemed to be related to a conflict between employees and the new interim head of the customs office. Workers accused him of being corrupted and responsible for the increase of customs clearance fees.

On 4 November 2023, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, several members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked, looted, and ransomed citizens and merchants along the National Road 1 (between Pont-Sonde and Carrefour Paye). During the attack, a trader was shot and injured in a leg. 1 injured.

On 4 November 2023, in Limbe, Nord, police forces shot and killed the leader of a gang operating in Limbe and Cap-Haitien as they engaged in a clash with the now deceased during a security operation. A firearm, ammunition, and a motorcycle were seized. 1 fatality.

On 3 November 2023, in Montrouis, Artibonite, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped a woman. She was released on 6 November as police forces carried out an operation and arrested one abductor. There is no further information on the circumstances and the perpetrators of the kidnapping although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related.

On 3 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, overnight, an unknown number of armed men ambushed a vehicle occupied by five members of the so called 'G-Shirt' rapper group, killing all of them (methods unspecified). The attack took place as the artists were coming back from a performance in Cite Soleil. The vehicle was found calcined on the Airport Road around 6 November, while the corpses of the victims were found in a grave in Clercine 12 neighbourhood around 8 November. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 5 fatalities.
On 3 November 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, two members of the Ti Bwa Gang raped a 13-year-old girl as she was intercepted on her way home.

Around 1 November 2023 (between 29 October - 3 November), around Plaisance, Nord, gang members shot and wounded a passenger in a truck near Morne Pilboro area. They hijacked a truck of petrol as well as a truck of rice. 1 injured.

On 1 November 2023, in Mariani, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang clashed with police forces as they tried to take control of the area. The gangsters ambushed a police patrol, killing one officer and injuring several others. The corpse of the deceased was taken by the gangsters, who decapitated him. Gunshots were heard across the Mariani neighborhoods. The National Directorate of Drinking Water and Sanitation (DINEPA) facilities were assaulted and its occupation persisted for at least eight days. This happened a day after the Grand-Ravine Gang attacked residents in the commune on 31 October (coded separately). One source attributed these attacks to the Baz 5 Secondes Gang, although this was not confirmed by other media. 1 fatality, several injured.

Around 1 November 2023 (as reported), in the Nord-Ouest department (coded to Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest), police forces shot and killed a gang member operating in Port-de-Paix and arrested another individual during a security operation. 1 fatality.

On 31 October 2023, in Mariani, Ouest, overnight, the Grand-Ravine Gang attacked residents at their houses, killing and injuring an unspecified number of civilians whose bodies were taken by the gangsters. Two police patrols were stolen and their tires taken off the wheels to prevent security forces from using them. As gang members got into the properties, residents fled the area. Gunshots were heard across the Mariani neighbourhoods. One source attributed the attack to the Baz 5 Secondes Gang, although this was not confirmed by other media. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 31 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, gang members kidnapped a female doctor. No further details on the circumstances of the abduction were mentioned, although it is known that a ransom (nature unspecified) was asked as a condition for the liberation. Her family claimed not to be able to pay such amount of money and demanded her release. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 31 October 2023, in Bord de Mer Limonade, Nord, police forces shot and killed four gang members and arrested eight others (two men and six women) during a security operation that aimed at seizing a criminal. An important arsenal was seized. 4 fatalities.

Around 31 October 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two masked policemen at the service of the Head of the Public Prosecution attacked a man as he protested against the Public Prosecutor. According to what it is showed in a video of the attack, the officers trampled the citizen for no apparent reason. The incident was described as a case of police brutality. There were no fatalities.

Around 30 October 2023 (as reported), in Gonaives, Artibonite, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped an unspecified number of people and asked a ransom as a condition for their release. On 30 October, when two abductors went to a location to receive the payment, police forces arrested them. There is no further information on the perpetrators and the circumstances of the abduction, but latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 30 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, four police officers violently mistreated, dragged, and beat up a political activist at the Courthouse in the presence of the Government Commissioner of Port-au-Prince. It happened as the activist came to support a journalist implicated in a defamation case and the Government Commissioner ordered his arrest. The incident was described as an attack against the right to freedom of expression. The victim's health state was not clarified. Casualties unknown.

On 29 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of individuals kidnapped an employee of the Centre for Analysis and Research in Human Rights (CARDH). The abduction was said to be related to the victim's work as human rights defender. The victim was released on 7 November under unspecified circumstances.

On 29 October 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Ti Grif Gang during a clash. The deceased was described as an ally of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang. 1 fatality.

On 28 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men shot and killed a policewoman when she was driving on her way home after service (off-duty), in the Morne Hercule area. A video on social media showed the corpse of the victim lying on the road with her firearm above her. Another source stated that the shooters stole the arm. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, dozens of people demonstrated after the killing of a public transport driver who was shot at by a police officer (coded separately). Also, demonstrators burned tires near the police sub-commissariat.

On 27 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, employees from an unspecified company were kidnapped. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the abduction. However, latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victims' whereabouts are unknown.

On 27 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, a public transport driver was shot dead by a police officer after refusing to obey the police officer's orders on the road going to the airport. Other public transport drivers tried to apprehend the police officer but he fled after firing shots in the air. 1 fatality.

On 27 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men shot and killed an off-duty police officer on the Sylvio Cator Street, in Delmas 24. The deceased had been suspended from his duties due to a pending case. Motivation for the attack unknown. 1 fatality.

On 26 October 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, police forces shot and killed an armed man and injured several of his accomplices during a clash. It happened as the police intercepted them looting private properties in the area. 1 fatality, several injured.
Around 25 October 2023 (as reported), in Chambellan, Grande-Anse, a mob of residents from Boucan village killed a man and burned his body. The victim was accused of being a thief. 1 fatality.

On 25 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members killed a parent on his way back from dropping his kid at school. They then stole his car. The report indicates that another parent's car was stolen the previous day in the same area. 1 fatality.

On 25 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, public employees of the Directorate of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) held a demonstration in front of the DIE headquarters, in Lalue neighbourhood, to demand the release of a colleague who was abducted on 21 October (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires.

On 24 October 2023, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang opened fire on a minibus on National Road 1, as the driver refused to stop the march, killing at least three civilians and injuring six. Police forces, who intervened after the attack and clashed with the gangsters (coded separately), arrested the driver as he had been informed that gang members were on the road but he decided to continue the march, putting the passengers at risk. At least 3 fatalities, 6 injured.

On 24 October 2023, in Mirebalais, Mirebalais, a mob of residents grabbed an arrested man from a police vehicle and lynched him to death. The victim's body was set on fire. He was described as a gang member and as the cousin of the 400 Mawozo Gang leader. He had a weapon and around 1 million gourdes in his possession. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

On 24 October 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked residents, set fire to several houses, stole some weapons, and kidnapped an unspecified number of civilians. Their whereabouts are unknown. Casualties unknown.
On 24 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, people demonstrated by erecting barricades of burning tires and tree branches to demand that the authorities clean the area after the heavy rains.

On 24 October 2023, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, police forces clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang after they had attacked civilians travelling in a minibus moments before (coded separately). The gang members fled the scene on motorcycles. Casualties unknown.

On 24 October 2023, in Thomassique, Centre, police forces clashed with two armed men moving in an unregistered vehicle (drive-by). The clash happened as the policemen carried out a security operation. One armed man was injured by the bullets. He was a Dominican national. Both were arrested. 1 injured.

On 24 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, public employees of the Directorate of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) held a demonstration in front of the DIE headquarters, in Lalue neighbourhood, to demand the release of a colleague who was abducted on 21 October (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires. The activity at the institution was interrupted.

On 24 October 2023, in Savien, Artibonite, police forces shot and injured an unknown number of affiliates of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang and arrested one as they carried out a security operation in the area. Several injured.

Around 23 October 2023 (between 15 - 31 October), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu gang) attacked residents, burned houses, and kidnapped trucks transporting goods. This was part of an offensive that aimed at taking the control of the area. At least 201 people were killed or injured as a result of attacks by these gangs in late October in the communes of Carrefour and Gressier (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals kidnapped a public employee of the Ministry of State and Territorial Collectivities (MICT) when he was moving in a work vehicle between Lalue and Bourdon neighbourhoods. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of the abduction, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 23 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, public employees of the Directorate of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) held a demonstration in front of the DIE headquarters, in Lalue neighbourhood, to demand the release of a colleague who was abducted on 21 October (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires. The activity at the immigration institution was interrupted.

Around 23 October 2023 (between 15 - 31 October), in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, the Grand-Ravine Gang and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu gang) attacked residents, burned houses, and kidnapped trucks transporting goods. This was part of an offensive that aimed at taking the control of the area. At least 201 people were killed or injured as a result of attacks by these gangs in late October in the communes of Carrefour (coded separately) and Gressier. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 22 October 2023, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked the commune and destroyed a number of houses. Casualties unknown.

On 22 October 2023, in Anse a Foleur, Nord-Ouest, police forces shot and killed two gang members during a clash in a zone known as 'Blok Mon Van'. One of the deceased was described as a gang leader and as the ally of another gang operating in Ti Bwadom area (Gros-Morne). 2 fatalities.

On 21 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals kidnapped a man on the Carbone Street as he was on his way to purchase second-hand tires. The abducted is an employee of the Directorate of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) assigned to the passport production department. Kidnappers asked for a ransom of 600,000 USD as a condition for his release. He was liberated on 29 October after the ransom was paid.

On 21 October 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals opened fire on a convoy of vehicles belonging to the National Directorate of Drinking Water and Sanitation, in the Beudet area. No one was injured and only material damages were mentioned on several vehicles due to the impact of the bullets. The motivation for the attack is unknown. There were no casualties.

On 20 October 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme Gang clashed with members of the 400 Mawozo Gang. Gunshots were also heard earlier in the day in the Duval neighborhood near Marassa Crossroad. Casualties unknown.

On 18 October 2023, in Camp Perrin, Sud, two armed individuals kidnapped an NGO worker when he stopped his vehicle to let students cross the street. The kidnappers took him to Les Cayes, stole his cash, phones, and a tablet, and released him a day later in Saint-Michel du Sud (Nippes). There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related.

On 18 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men in a vehicle opened fire on a crowd of people in Morne-Marinette area, in Bel-Air neighbourhood, killing at least four civilians and injuring 19 others (drive-by). According to witnesses, the shooters were dressed in police uniforms. The motivation for the attack is unknown. At least 4 fatalities, 19 injured.

On 18 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed gang members kidnapped a former minister and his driver as they travelled between Debussy and Turgeau neighborhoods. The victim is a member of the High Transitional Council for elections (HCT). One source stated that the perpetrators were dressed in police uniforms, while another stated that they moved in a police patrol, where they forced the victim to enter before driving off. The HCT member was released on 30 October after a ransom was paid, and the driver was released on 15 November in exchange of a supplemental ransom. On 6 November, as a messenger man was sent to deliver the money, the gang members killed him after claiming that the amount submitted was not what was agreed (coded separately).

On 17 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, people gathered between MLK Avenue and John Brown Avenue and set burning barricades in Oswald Durand Street. There is no information on the circumstances of the gathering or barricade.

On 17 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gang member during a clash between Des Casernes and Du Centre streets. Another gang member managed to flee. A fire arm was seized. The gangsters had attacked a moto taxi driver moments before (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 17 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, two gang members attacked a moto taxi driver between Des Casernes and Du Centre streets (near Port-au-Prince - Centre Ville), although no further details on the event were mentioned. Police forces intervened and killed one of them (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 16 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the fourth consecutive day, gang members affiliated to the G-9 Gang coalition engaged in clashes in La Saline neighbourhood. Gunshots were heard in several areas, including near Gonaives Station and Chancerelles. These clashes were related to the killing of a gang leader in September (coded separately). Between 13 and 16 October, at least 29 people were killed, most of them by stray bullets, during gang clashes in La Saline. At least 29 fatalities split across four events. 7 fatalities coded for this event.

On 15 October 2023, in Mirebalais, Centre, a mob of residents, armed with machetes, lynched and burned a gang member whom they grabbed by force from a police station were he was under custody. The victim was said to be the member of a gang operating in Cite-Soleil. Photos of a gang leader were found in his phone. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

On 15 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, gang members affiliated to the G-9 Gang coalition engaged in clashes in La Saline neighbourhood, the Varreux, Pont Rouge, and Bas Delmas areas. These clashes were related to the killing of a gang leader in September (coded separately). Between 13 and 16 October, at least 29 people were killed, most of them by stray bullets, during gang clashes in La Saline. At least 29 fatalities split across four events. 7 fatalities coded for this event.

On 14 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, at least three gangs affiliated to the G-9 Gang coalition engaged in clashes in La Saline neighbourhood. One gangster was killed. These clashes were related to the killing of a gang leader in September (coded separately). Between 13 and 16 October, at least 29 people were killed, most of them by stray bullets, during gang clashes in La Saline. At least 29 fatalities split across four events. 8 fatalities coded for this event.

On 13 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, at least three gangs affiliated to the G-9 Gang coalition engaged in clashes in La Saline neighbourhood. Some armed men were described as affiliates of a gang from Wharf de Jeremie area and others as affiliates of a gang from Bas Delmas. Clashes were related to the killing of a gang leader in September (coded separately). An unknown number of people were killed (affiliation unspecified) and some houses were burned. A member of the Council of Administration of Communal Sections (CASEC) went missing. Hundreds of students and staff members got stuck at a school as armed clashes took place outside. They were taken hostage by the gang members. They were eventually evacuated in a bus on 15 October. Gunshots were also heard in Nazon and Carrefour-Feuilles neighborhoods. Between 13 and 16 October, at least 29 people were killed, most of them by stray bullets, during gang clashes in La Saline. At least 29 fatalities split across four events. 7 fatalities coded for this event

On 12 October 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of a gang raped an unknown number of women and girls at their homes as they attacked the commune. Two women were shot and killed and a third one was kidnapped. Her whereabouts are unknown. 2 fatalities.

On 10 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, armed men shot and killed a person and injured another one during an attack against the members of a family in Bellevue-La Montagne village. The shooting took place as the victims were trying to recover some belongings from their residence, which was located in an area under the control of the Vitelhomme Gang. The perpetrators were said to be affiliates of this gang. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 10 October 2023, near Mayer, Ouest, police forces shot and killed three members of the 400 Mawozo Gang during a clash on the National Road 3, at the height of the Daspinosse neighbourhood. Two riffles were seized. This was part of a police anti-gang operation. 3 fatalities.

On 9 October 2023, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, in the morning, members of the Savien Gang killed at least one bus driver and injured several civilians (methods unspecified) during an attack on the National Road 1. Two buses were diverted and several people kidnapped. There whereabouts are unknown. At least 1 fatality, several injured.

On 9 October 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, unidentified armed men opened fire on a Tele Zip journalists' vehicle as he was driving. He escaped unharmed. This was the second assassination attempt against him since 29 September (coded separately). There were no casualties.

On 8 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, more than 10 armed gang members dressed in police uniforms occupied the Rendez-vous Christ church, in Delmas 75, and kidnapped several parishioners and the security guard of a pastor. Phones and other belongings from the members of the church were stolen. The attackers were expected to target the pastor of the church, as three gang members pretending to be parishioners were said to have been placed in the front seats to identify him, although he managed to escape unharmed. The attack took place as the religious service was being shared live on Facebook. As the gang members tried to run away, they engaged in a clash with police forces (coded separately). The security guard was released on 14 October. The whereabouts of the other abducted are unknown.

On 8 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police forces clashed with more than 10 gang members as they intervened to seize the criminals who had looted a church and kidnapped at least one parishioner moments before (coded separately). During the clash, a gang member was shot and killed. Simultaneously, a police officer moving in a patrol was killed by the gangsters on Catalpa Street. The gang members forced him to exit the vehicle, shot at him, and fled the scene in the patrol. 2 fatalities.

On 7 October 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gang member and injured and arrested another one during a security operation, on La Fleur Street, that resulted on the releasing of three people who had been kidnapped several days before in Delmas, where these gangsters used to operate (coded separately). A weapon was seized. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

Around 5 October 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members operating in several areas in the commune kidnapped three people, including a man and a young woman. The abducted were released on 7 October as part of a police operation in the Tabarre commune (coded separately).
Around 5 October 2023 (as reported), in Liancourt, Artibonite, police forces shot and killed several members of the Ti Grif Gang during a clash. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 4 October 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang, supported by the Canaan Gang, looted and set fire to a police station. Some equipment were stolen. The policemen at their posts left the place to avoid being injured. There were no casualties.

On 4 October 2023, near Petite-Anse, Nord, the police killed five gang members, wounded four individuals, and arrested four others during an operation in the Madeline locality. They also seized weapons and ammunitions. 5 fatalities, 4 injured.

On 4 October 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang threw Molotov cocktails against police forces in the Beudet area. It happened as police forces carried out an intervention to remove barricades and destroy several structures used by the gangsters to perpetrate attacks. Casualties unknown.

On 3 October 2023, in Ouanaminthe, Nord-Est, a group of citizens set fire to a set of products coming from the Dominican Republic. The action was described as a reaction to measures recently taken by the Dominican authorities, including the closure of all borders with Haiti (coded separately).

On 3 October 2023, in Gros-Morne, Artibonite, the Kokorat San Ras Gang raped 17 street vendors women (described as Madan Sara women) who were intercepted on their way to a local market for labor purposes. After being raped, the gangsters kidnapped them and forced them to walk naked toward the captivity location. Their whereabouts are unknown.
On 2 October 2023, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, police forces shot and killed the member of a gang operating in the area. The deceased was described as an affiliate of the Gep Nwa Gang. 1 fatality.
On 30 September 2023, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gang member during a clash. The deceased was described as the leader of a gang operating in the commune. 1 fatality.

On 30 September 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, members of the Canaan Gang set fire to a police station in the Onaville neighbourhood. No one was injured, as the police officers who were inside were able to flee unharmed. A power generator and two vehicles were burned. The gangsters set up barricades in the area. The attack was described as a reprisal for the arrest of two members of the gang. There were no casualties.

On 29 September 2023, in Croix Des Bouquets district (coded to Croix-des-Bouquets), Ouest, gunshots were heard in La Plaine du Cul-de-Sac area. The perpetrators were said to be members of rival gangs (affiliation unknown) who engaged in clashes. Casualties unknown.

On 29 September 2023, near Thomas, Ouest, overnight, masked armed men kidnapped five members of a family at a house in St Medard community, and shot and killed them moments later, as stated by witnesses who heard the gunshots. The bodies were found in Ravine Thomas area. There was a woman among the victims. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 5 fatalities.

On 29 September 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men opened fire on a Tele Zip journalist's vehicle as he was driving home in the Lilava neighbourhoods. The victim escaped unharmed. The motivation for the attack is unknown. There were no casualties.

On 29 September 2023, in Santo, Ouest, unidentified armed men opened fire on a truck transporting goods in the Meyer area, killing one person and injuring three others. The affiliation of the victims was not clarified. 1 fatality, 3 injured.

On 28 September 2023, in Les Cayes, Sud, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle opened fire on a vehicle, killing a business man who was being transported by his driver (drive-by). Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 28 September 2023 (as reported), in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, mobs of residents lynched around 10 members of the Canaan Gang. The mobsters were affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement and the attack was described as vigilante violence. At least 10 fatalities.

On 28 September 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, members of the Canaan Gang attacked areas under the control of the Chien Mechant Gang in the Lilavwa and Lizon neighborhoods, among others in La Plaine du Cul-de-Sac area, as they looked for the leader of the gang. Gunshots were heard. Casualties unknown.

On 28 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, the Base Nan Tokyo Gang and the Base Project La Saline Gang clashed with G-9 gang members as they accused the leader of the G-9 Gang of ordering the killing of a gang leader in Cite Soleil on 26 September (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 27 September 2023, in Marin, Ouest, members of the Belekou Gang clashed with members of the Chien Mechant gang. Several gang members were killed. Several people were injured, and several houses burned together with a church in the Lizon neighbourhood. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 27 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, the Base Nan Tokyo Gang and the Base Project La Saline Gang clashed with G-9 gang members as they accused the leader of the G-9 Gang of ordering the killing of a gang leader in Cite Soleil the day prior (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 27 September 2023, in Croix Des Bouquets district (coded to Croix-des-Bouquets), Ouest, overnight, unidentified armed men killed a judge and substitute for the government commissioner at the Mirebalais First Instance Court at his home, in La Plaine du Cul-de-Sac area (methods unknown). The motivation for the attack is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 27 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, gang members opened fire on a police station in Delmas 2. It happened amidst clashes between rival gangs in the area (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 26 September 2023, in Mirebalais, Centre, a mob of residents lynched at least 13 members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang. At least one was burned alive. Some of the gangsters were accused of having participated in the shooting of the Mirebalais Hospital the night prior (coded separately). The mobsters were affiliates of the Bwa Kale Movement and the attack was described as vigilante violence. At least 13 fatalities.

On 26 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, overnight, G-9 gang members shot and killed a leader and around five members of a gang operating in Carrefour Vincent and Drouillard. Other sources counted up to 11 gangsters killed. The attack, that took place near the Fontaine Hospital (Menas neighbourhood), was ordered by the G-9 Gang leader against members of the Nan Boston gang -allies of the G-9 Gang coalition- with whom he had a conflict. The cause of this conflict was said to be the deceased's refusal to respect the instructions of the G-9 Gang and the 'Living Together' movement (coded separately). Gunshots were heard around the commune. At least 6 fatalities.

On 26 September 2023, in Mirebalais, Centre, police forces shot and killed several members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang and seized a number of weapons belonging to them during an operation in the commune. Around 10 gangsters were killed as a result of police interventions in Mirebalais and Saut-d'Eau on that day. Other sources counted almost 20 fatalities between the two locations. These interventions were carried out a day after members of the gang attacked residents and a hospital in Mirebalais and Saut-d'Eau (coded separately). At least 10 fatalities split across two events.

On 26 September 2023, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, police forces shot and killed at least four gang members and seized a number of weapons belonging to them during a security operation. They were said to be affiliates of the Base 5 Seconded Gang and the Canaan Gang. A mob of residents supporting the officers and members of the Bwa Kale movement burned the bodies of killed gangsters. Around 10 gangsters were killed as a result of police interventions in Mirebalais and Saut-d'Eau on that day. Other sources counted almost 20 gang fatalities between the two locations. These interventions were carried out a day after gang members attacked residents in the above mentioned locations (coded separately). At least 10 fatalities split across two events.

On 25 September 2023, in Mirebalais, Centre, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang, supported by the Canaan Gang, attacked residents in the commune, killing at least one person. A transfer office was looted. At least seven civilians were injured as a result of attacks by the Base 5 Secondes Gang in Saut-d'Eau and Mirebalais on that day. Overnight, the criminals opened fire on the Mirebalais University Hospital (HUM), although no one was injured. Only material damages were mentioned. The hospital suspended his activity following the attack. At least 1 fatality.

On 25 September 2023, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang, together with the Canaan Gang and the Titanyen Gang, clashed with police forces as they attacked residents and tried to take control of the commune. According to some sources around 200 armed gangsters were in the area. This was the second attack by these gang members since 22 September (coded separately). Several versions were given as motivation for these attacks. One stated that it was a reprisal for the robbery of weapons by armed men from a vehicle belonging to the gangsters (coded separately). Another described it as a reprisal for the arrest of gangsters involved in a kidnapping earlier that day (coded separately). At least seven civilians were injured as a result of gang attacks in Saut-d'Eau and Mirebalais on that day.

On 25 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two members of the Vitelhomme Gang during a security operation. Several fire arms were seized. 2 fatalities.

On 23 September 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, in the early morning, armed men of unspecified affiliation blocked the National Road 1 with barricades of big stones, pieces of vehicles, and debris, as they demanded the departure of Prime Minister, Ariel Henry. The blockade was removed by the police on 24 September. Barricades were simultaneously set up in other locations of the Ouest department by armed men over the same claim (coded separately).

On 23 September 2023, in Marin, Ouest, in the early morning, armed men of unspecified affiliation blocked Carrefour Shada and Carrefour Drouillard areas with barricades of big stones, pieces of vehicles, and debris, as they demanded the departure of Prime Minister, Ariel Henry. Barricades were simultaneously set up in other locations of the Ouest department by armed men over the same claim (coded separately).

On 22 September 2023, near Saut-d'Eau, Centre, unidentified gang members perpetrated a kidnapping, although the number of victims and the circumstances of the abduction were not clarified. Several individuals involved in the kidnapping were arrested by the police. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

Around 22 September 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked a vehicle on his way to Village de Dieu neighbourhood (methods unspecified) and stole a number of weapons. The vehicle belonged the Base 5 Secondes Gang. In reprisal, members of this gang attacked Saut-d'Eau on 22 September (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 22 September 2023, in Saut-d'Eau, Centre, overnight, the Base 5 Secondes Gang, together with the Canaan Gang and the Titanyen Gang, set fire to a police station, several houses and vehicles, as they attacked residents and tried to take control of the commune. At least 11 civilians were shot and killed, while at least 14 were injured. Others were kidnapped, including a truck driver. Some residents fled the area. Two police officers who were at the post were forced to leave their workplace, as the gang members chased them and tried to shoot them. The gangsters, who had arrived on motorcycles, stole 14 vehicles before fleeing the area. Several versions were given as motivation for the attack. One stated that it was a reprisal for the robbery of weapons by armed men from a vehicle belonging to the gangsters (coded separately). Another described it as a reprisal for the arrest of gangsters involved in a kidnapping earlier that day (coded separately). The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. At least 11 fatalities, at least 14 injured.

Around 20 September 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed several gang members during anti-gang operations in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. The policemen removed barricades that had been set up by the gangsters. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 20 September 2023, between Port-au-Prince - Delmas and Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, citizens and political militants held a march from Carrefour Aeroport neighbourhood (Delmas) demanding the departure of Prime Minister, Ariel Henry, against insecurity and political mismanagement, among other claims. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires. When the crowd reached Petionville, police forces intervened using tear gas to disperse them, leading to clashes between policemen and rioters. The demonstration was held on the occasion of the 265th anniversary of the Emperor James I birthday.
On 20 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, the police chased unidentified armed men traveling on motorcycles. Gunshots were heard during the incident. Casualties unknown.
On 19 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme Gang attacked the Nan Pierre Paul area. They killed three people and set fire to several houses. 3 fatalities.

On 19 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, the police clashed with members of the Vitelhomme Gang near Vivy Mitchell and Bellevue. There is no information on the circumstances of the clash. Casualties unknown.

On 18 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, four members of the Vitelhomme Gang attacked the Kafou Tenten neighborhood. During the attack, they killed one man, injured another, and burned vehicles and homes. 1 fatality. 1 injured.

On 18 September 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, for the fifth consecutive day, police forces clashed with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang as affiliates of the organization tried to recover the corpses of gangsters who were killed in previous clashes with the officers (coded separately). Between 17 and 18 September, nine gang members were killed by the police. 9 fatalities split across two events coded by ACLED.

Around 17 September 2023 (weekend of), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme Gang attacked the Vivy Mitchell neighbourhood. Several houses were looted. Some civilians fled the area to take refuge elsewhere. Casualties unknown.

On 17 September 2023, between Port-au-Prince and Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, supporters and militants of the Committed to Development (EDE) party, dressed in white, held a march for peace and to demand the resignation of Prime Minister, Ariel Henry, among other claims. Demonstrators marched through Lalue, Nazon, Bourdon, and Delmas 33, among other neighbourhoods, and burned tires on the Delmas Road. The demonstration was attended by the leader of the EDE party.

On 17 September 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, for the fourth consecutive day, police forces clashed with the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang as affiliates of the organization tried to recover the corpses of gangsters who were killed in previous clashes with the officers (coded separately). Between 17 and 18 September, nine gang members were killed by the police. 9 fatalities split across two events coded by ACLED.

On 16 September 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped a man doctor near his residence in Lizon area. The kidnappers asked for a ransom of 50,000 USD as a condition for his release. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 16 September 2023, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Armee Kosovo group, injured two members of the organization, and arrested a total of four. It happened during a security operation in the Conassa neighbourhood. A weapon was seized. 1 fatality, 2 injured.

On 16 September 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, for the third consecutive day, police forces clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, killing 21 gang affiliates between 14 and 16 September. As part of this police operation, several gangsters were also killed in nearby Savien village that day (coded separately). 21 fatalities split across three events coded by ACLED.

On 16 September 2023, in Savien, Artibonite, police forces clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang during an operation, killing several gangsters. As part of this police operation, several gangsters were also killed in nearby Liancourt that day (coded separately). Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 15 September 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, for the second consecutive day, police forces clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, killing 21 gang affiliates between 14 and 16 September. 21 fatalities split across three events coded by ACLED.

On 14 September 2023, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, unidentified armed men shot at the house of the commissioner of the Petit-Goave government. It is unknown whether the property was occupied at the moment of the shooting, only material damages on the facade were mentioned. The motivation for the attack was not clarified, although it happened a day after a police operation resulted in the killing of a man and the injuring of four others (coded separately). There were no casualties.

On 14 September 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, police forces clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, killing 21 gang affiliates between 14 and 16 September. 21 fatalities split across three events coded by ACLED.

Around 14 September 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, residents, former public servants, supporters of former President Jovenel Moise, and activists held a march demanding the resignation of Prime Minister, Ariel Henry, among other claims. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires and blocked road traffic.

Around 13 September 2023 (between 11 - 17 September), in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Savien gang burned to death a young man. The victim was said to be a member of a rival gang. Several people (affiliation unspecified) were found dead as clashes between rival gangsters took place in the area. At least 1 fatality.

Around 13 September 2023 (between 11 - 17 September), near Liancourt, Artibonite, a mob of residents captured and killed a man (methods unknown) in Chandelle village. He was said to be close to the Savien Gang, although his affiliation to the organization was not confirmed. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

On 13 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, according to residents, individuals dressed in police uniforms executed three young people in Gouye in Meyotte locality. It is unclear if the victims are civilians or connected to gang activities.

On 13 September 2023, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a man and injured four others during a security operation in 'Nan Percin' neighbourhood. Nine individuals were arrested and at least three structures used as refuge were burned by the police. It was not clarified whether the individuals were armed or if they were affiliated with an armed group. 1 fatality, 4 injured.

On 13 September 2023, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, residents held a demonstration in the 'Nan Percin' neighbourhood to demand the resignation of Prime Minister, Ariel Henry, and to decry insecurity and unemployment, among other claims. Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires, tried to burn the Peace Court, and threw stones against the vehicle of the commissioner governor and police forces, who intervened with fire weapons and tear gas to disperse the rioters. At least one demonstrator was killed and several were injured by the gunshots. At least 1 fatality, several injured.

On 12 September 2023, in Port-au-Princes, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. They were attributed to members of the Grand-Ravine Gang, who had been attacking residents in the area since 13 August (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 12 September 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, police officers clashed with other policemen whom they accused of supporting the Ti Bwa Gang. During clashes, an unknown number of officers were killed, although their affiliation was not clarified. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 11 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, al least three men physically aggressed a woman near the Boyer square. The victim, who got punched in her eyes, was identified by the attackers as the girlfriend of a member of the Democratic and Popular Sector (SDP). It was not clarified whether she had a relationship with the politician, although she was known to be a SDP supporter. 1 injured.

On 11 September 2023, in Jeremie, Grande-Anse, residents held a demonstration to oppose the visit of Prime Minister (PM), Ariel Henry, to the 'Nan Site' neighbourhood on the occasion of the start of the school year. Demonstrators blocked the 'Zaboka' Carrefour with a parked bus and threw stones and bottles against the motorcade of official vehicles transporting the PM and his team. At least one vehicle was damaged. Police forces intervened using tear gas and firing shots into the air to disperse the rioters.

On 10 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Belair Gang fired shots as they attacked residents in Poste-Marchand, Solino, Delmas 24, and Fort National neighbourhoods. At least two houses were set on fire. An unspecified number of civilians were killed. Some residents fled the area and took refuge elsewhere in the capital. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 10 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince, the police clashed with gang members from Belair in the Fort National neighborhood. Gunshots were also heard in the Solino and Lalue areas. The latter location was deserted as residents fled their homes, possibly due to the clashes. The gang members also invaded Poste Marchand, creating panic in the area. Casualties unknown.

On 7 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, members of the Belair Gang attacked residents and burned houses in the Solino neighbourhood. An unspecified number of people were killed, including a police officer and anothe person. Other people were injured. Gunshots were also heard in areas like Carrefour-Feuilles and Nazon. At least 2 fatalities. Several injured.

Around 6 September 2023 (as reported), off the Coast of Bainet, Sud-Est, members of two drug cartels clashed, resulting in the killing of a Colombian gangster and an unspecified number of others. The corpse of the Colombian was found in the sea. The clash was part of a fight over the control of drug deliveries in the area. On 13 September, a drug dealer was arrested in connection with the clash. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 6 September 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang killed a man. His body was then burned inside of his vehicle. 1 fatality.
On 6 September 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo Gang attacked a police station in Onaville, forcing the officers to leave their posts. Casualties unknown.

On 6 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Belair Gang clashed with police forces as they attacked residents and burned houses in the Solino, Nazon, Bas Delmas, Delmas 24, Corridor Bastia, and Carrefour Pean neighbourhoods, among others. They also looted and set fire to warehouses and stalls at the Carrefour Pean Market. During clashes, a police officer and several gangsters were killed. An unspecified number of civilians were killed and injured. Among the fatal victims, there was an university teacher. At least 2 fatalities.

On 5 September 2023, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, residents held a demonstration to decry insecurity and demanding the resignation of national authorities. Demonstrators threw stones and erected barricades of burning tires.

On 5 September 2023, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gang member during a clash in La Saline area. The deceased was affiliated to a gang operating in the Ti Bwadom neighbourhood (Gros-Morne). 1 fatality.

On 4 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, two unidentified armed men carried out a kidnapping near Cite Okay between Delmas 31 and the airport road. They were traveling in a vehicle and shot at another vehicle during the abduction. The number of people who were abducted is unclear. There is no information on the circumstances or perpetrators of the abduction, but latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim(s) whereabouts are unknown.

On 4 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the police shot and killed several gangsters as security forces carried out an anti-gang operation in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 4 September 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, the police clashed with gang members. Several gang members were wounded and ten people arrested. One police officer was also wounded. Several injured.

On 2 September 2023, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite, Artibonite, members of the Palmiste Gang kidnapped around 20 civilians. According to one resident, the gangsters had a list with the names of the people who they had to abduct. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 2 September 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang fired shots, looted several houses, and kidnapped more than 30 people who travelled in a truck. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown. Casualties unknown.

On 2 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, a mob of residents chased and killed three individuals (methods unknown) moving in a vehicle and accused of having tried to commit a robbery moments before, in Delmas 19 and on Mackandal Street. The corpses of the deceased were burned in Delmas 31. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 3 fatalities.

On 2 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, in the early morning, police forces shot and killed three gang members and injured another one during an intervention to thwart a kidnapping attempt, in Delmas 31. A vehicle and some weapons were seized. 3 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 1 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men moving in a vehicle and two individuals riding motorcycles kidnapped two employees of the National Old Age Insurance Office (ONA) when they were about the enter their posts, in Delmas 31. The kidnapping was recorded by a surveillance camera. The perpetrators demanded a ransom of unknown nature as a condition for the victims' liberation. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 1 September 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, members of the Belair Gang kidnapped a Dominican citizen in Delmas 31 while he was on his way back from work. They have requested a USD 200.000 ransom from his family in exchange for his release. There is no information on the whereabouts of the victim.

Around 1 September 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, a person was killed and their dead body was seen in Thomassin 32. Reports from passers-by indicate it might have been a killing from the popular Bwa Kale movement that has been taking matters into their own hands to kill gang members. 1 fatality.

Around 1 September 2023 (between 31 August - 1 September), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men shot and killed a military officer in front of his residence, in Delmas 33. 1 fatality.

On 31 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang attacked residents in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. The gangsters threw Molotov cocktails, fired shots near Jeremie square, burned, and looted some houses and churches. Several civilians were killed, including two members of a family whose house was firebombed. Several others were injured by gunshots. The bullets reached the facilities of the Medicine Faculty. This caused the mass displacement of residents towards Champ-de-Mars. At least 2 fatalities. Several injured.

On 31 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, barricades of burning tires were erected in the Bois Patate area. A crowd of people was also present. The report suggests that these may be related to a possible lynching in the area.

On 31 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified gang members kidnapped a man in Delmas 17 near the National Old-Age Insurance Office (ONA). The victim was kidnapped while in his car, which was left behind by the abductors. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 31 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, overnight, unidentified armed men shot and killed two people between Delmas 43 and 65, on Faustin Street. Although the authorship was not clarified, there were rumors that the perpetrators were gang members. 2 fatalities.

On 31 August 2023, in Port-de-Paix, Nord-Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gangster during a clash in the Demelus area. The deceased was described as an affiliate of the Air Force Clan Gang. 1 fatality.

On 30 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped a doctor and urology specialist in front of a pharmacy, on Berne Street. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim was released on 3 September after a ransom of unknown nature was paid to the kidnappers.
Around 30 August 2023 (as reported), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, police forces shot and killed the leader of a gang operating in Cite Doudoune. 1 fatality.

On 29 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, armed men attacked a group of residents. A lot of gunshots were heard. The Fouchard area was also impacted. Reports indicate that families have been fleeing the area. There is no information on the perpetrators or circumstances of the attack, but latest reports suggest that most attacks in the area around Carrefour-Feuilles during the past couple of weeks have been gang-related. Casualties unknown.

On 29 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang set fire to a police station in Savane Pistache, chasing and forcing the officers to leave their posts. A number of nearby houses were also burned. At least four people were killed during the attack (affiliation unknown). The gangsters posted a video on social media showing the police station on fire. At least 4 fatalities.

On 28 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, Vitelhomme gang members shot and killed two civilians who were in a vehicle near the US Embassy. The gangsters also fired shots against the Vehicle Insurance Office Against Third Parties (OAVCT) as they tried to take control of the facilities. Employees at place tried to escape from the shots, although several were injured. As gunshots were heard around the commune, some residents fled their homes. 2 fatalities, several injured.

On 28 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gangsters shot at a police patrol on Lamarre street in Poste-Marchand area, killing an officer. The corpse of the deceased was taken by the gangsters despite the efforts of the other policemen, who engaged in a clash with the criminals to prevent them from stealing the body. 1 fatality.

On 26 August 2023, between Port-au-Prince - Tabarre and Bon Repos, Ouest, hundreds of parishioners, called by a priest from the Piscine de Bethesda Evangelical Church, held a march from Caradeux neighbourhood (Tabarre) demanding the dismantling of the Canaan Gang. Among the demonstrators, there were individuals dressed in green uniforms and armed with machetes, sticks, and riffles. As the crowd marched through Rosemberg (Bon Repos), members of the Canaan gang opened fire on them, leading to clashes with the armed demonstrators, who had joined the march to confront the gangsters. At least 37 civilians were killed, including a girl, and around 30 were injured. At least a woman got her face wounded by the gunshots. Up to 17 parishioners were kidnapped. Some of them were tortured and burned alive, as showed by the gangsters on social media videos. The whereabouts of the other victims are unknown. At least 37 fatalities.

On 26 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members kidnapped a young woman on her way back from repairing a car near Le Palace Hotel in Champs-de-Mars. They also took the car. The kidnappers have requested a non-negotiable ransom of USD 200.000 from her family. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.
On 26 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the population burned at least 10 gang members' bodies after they were killed by the police in Carrefour Feuilles (coded separately).

On 26 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men, dressed in police uniforms and moving in a vehicle with a state license plate, entered a gas station, mistreated a worker and the security guard (no further details available), and kidnapped the worker, in Delmas 57. The perpetrators stole some materials and the guard's weapon before fleeing the scene with the cash register. There is no information on the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 26 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces shot and killed at least 10 members of the Grand-Ravine Gang during an anti-gang operation in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. The police seized several fire weapons. At least 10 fatalities.

On 25 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a person was kidnapped on Route de l'Aeroport. There is no information on the perpetrators or the circumstances of the abduction, but latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 25 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, a group of people burned tires in front of the French embassy and threw at the building. There is no information on the circumstances or motives of the barricades and stone-throwing.

On 25 August 2023, Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several tens of residents from the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood held a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Justice, the general headquarters of the Law Enforcement Unit (UDMO), and the West Departmental Directorate of the Police (DDO/PNH) to decry the violence of gangs, specially from the Grand-Ravine gang. They also demanded an intervention by military forces to defeat the gangsters. Rioters set up barricades of burning tires in Champs de Mars. Police forces guarding the Ministry's building fired shots to disperse the crowd.

On 25 August 2023, Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed a police officer when he was about to enter his residence in Delmas 33 (drive-by). The motivation and perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 24 August 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, overnight, unidentified gang members fired shots and attacked several neighbourhoods in the commune, including Cite Doudoune. Casualties unknown.

On 24 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, mobs of residents captured and killed an unspecified number of Grand-Ravine gangsters in reprisal for an armed attack against the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood earlier that day (coded separately). The attack was described as vigilante violence. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 24 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, unidentified gang members attacked several neighbourhoods including Nazon, Christ Roi, and Solino. The gangsters fired shots, injuring two civilians, and set fire to at least two vehicles on Martin Luther King Avenue, affecting the facilities of a close service station. Some residents fled their homes. Earlier that day, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked residents in Carrefour-Feuilles (coded separately). 2 injured.
On 24 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, overnight, unidentified gang members fired shots and attacked several neighbourhoods, including Delmas 30 and 32. Casualties unknown.

On 24 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, overnight, unidentified gang members fired shots and attacked several neighbourhoods in the commune. According to witnesses, the gangsters entered several factories and offices near the US Embassy. Casualties unknown.

On 24 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the afternoon, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked Savane Pistache, Saieh, and Sicot areas in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood, killing and injuring an unspecified number of civilians. Hundreds of residents fled their homes, as the gangsters set fire to some houses. Police forces used tear gas to disperse the gangsters, although the armed offensive persisted despite the officer's intervention. In reprisal, mobs of residents captured and killed some gangsters (coded separately). Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

Around 23 August 2023 (month of), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, members of the 400 Mawozo gang kidnapped five technician employees of the Digitel company in La Plaine du Cul-du-Sac area. The victims were released 29 days later without a ransom payment.

Around 23 August 2023 (as reported), in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified gang members threw a Molotov cocktail against a police vehicle in the Rosemberg area, although the officers managed to prevent its burning. The attack took place during a police intervention in the area. There were no casualties.

On 22 August 2023, between Port-au-Prince and Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, militants of social and political organizations, united under the '29 March Movement', held a demonstration against insecurity and gang violence, opposing the potential deployment of an international force in the country led by Kenya, and demanding the resignation of Prime Minister, Ariel Herny. Rioters set up barricades of burning tires on the Delmas Road. The demonstration was held on the occasion of the 232th anniversary of the Slave Revolt.

On 22 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, gang members fired gunshots and continued to set fire to residents' homes in Savane Pistache during attacks to take control of the area. Gunshots were also heard in the Carrefour Feuilles area. There is no information on whether civilians were harmed during the attacks. Casualties unknown.

On 22 August 2023, near Gros-Morne, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped the passengers of a bus belonging to the Patrick Coach Line Society in Ti Bwadom neighbourhood. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 22 August 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked a police station. The shooters hid at a camp and shot against the police facilities. An armed man was arrested a day later in connection with the attack. Casualties unknown.

Around 21 August 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members attacked several areas of Port-au-Prince, including Magasin de L'Etat and Saint-Honore Streets, as they tried to take the control of these zone. No further details were available. Casualties unknown.

Around 21 August 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, unidentified gang members attacked the Saint-Claire Market area as they tried to take the control of the zone. No further details were available. Casualties unknown.

On 21 August 2023, in Cap-Haitien, Nord, police forces shot and killed a gang member during a clash in the Conassa neighbourhood. A revolver and ammunition were seized. The gangster belonged to a criminal organization operating in Pont Neuf. 1 fatality.

On 21 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang clashed with police forces in Savane Pistache as they attacked residents and tried to take the control of the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Several civilians were injured as the gangsters set fire to some houses. The armed clash occurred after an offensive carried out in the previous week (coded separately) by the Grand-Ravine gang to take control of the area. Several injured.

On 21 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle shot and killed two civilians who were at a hair dressing salon on La Reunion Street (drive-by). Another person was injured by the bullets. Among the fatal victims, there was the owner of the business, who was a former employee of the National Palace. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

Around 20 August 2023 (as reported), in Deschapelles, Artibonite, residents killed gang members. A total of 19 gang members were lynched in Deschapelles and Pot Sonde (coded separately). There is no information on the circumstances and methods of the killings. 19 fatalities split over two events.

Around 20 August 2023 (as reported), in Pont Sonde, Artibonite, residents killed gang members. A total of 19 gang members were lynched in Pont Sonde and Deschapelles (coded separately). There is no information on the circumstances and methods of the killings. 19 fatalities split over two events coded.

On 19 August 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang abducted three football player men in the La Croix-Perisse area when they were on their way to Gonaives. The kidnappers asked the Football Club for the supply of ammunition as a condition for their release. The club was said not to be able to provide ammunition, although an agreement was reached to pay an amount of money equivalent to an ammunition box. The victims were released a day later.

On 19 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, two unidentified men, who pretended to be members of the press, physically aggressed a journalist woman and spokesperson for the Haitian Association of Online Media (AHML). The nature of the aggression was not clarified. It happened as she covered an event at the Airport Carrefour area.

On 19 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the police clashed with gang members in Onaville in the Route Nationale #3 area. Some reports indicate the police officers had to receive backup from colleagues due to the difficulty of the situation. Casualties unknown.

On 18 August 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of a Chandelle self-defense group clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grift de Savien gang in response to a gang attack against civilians (coded separately). At least four gangsters were shot and killed. At least 4 fatalities.

On 18 August 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grift de Savien attacked, looted, and burned several houses. At least 20 civilians were kidnapped, while a girl was shot and injured as the gangsters attacked her house and she tried to oppose the kidnapping of her mother. Following the attack, members of a self-defense group clashed with the gangsters (coded separately) The whereabouts of the abducted are unknown. Casualties unknown.

On 18 August 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, the Canaan Gang attacked the Rosemberg area and heavy gunshots were heard in the nearby Lilavois neighbourhood. Children at the Rosemberg orphanage fled the area and took refuge elsewhere. The gangsters looted and stole the orphanage once the building had been abandoned by the children. Casualties unknown.

On 18 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, in the afternoon, an armed man and a police officer assigned to the Polifront police station fired shots against the headquarters of the National Human Rights Defence Network (RNDDH), on Riviere Street, causing material damages to a main barrier and to a solar panel. The shooting took place two hours after the release of a RNDDH report on latest human rights violations in Haiti. The attack was said to aim at intimidating human rights defenders in the development of their work. There were no casualties.

On 18 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces clashed with two gang members, shooting and killing them. According to the officers, the deceased were moving in minibus used to rob the drivers in the area. 2 fatalities.
