On 18 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, unidentified armed men attacked the residence of the former Inspector General of the National police of Haiti and former deputy ombudsman of the Citizen Protection Office (OPC). It was not clarified whether there were people inside when the attack took place, although only material damages were reported. There were no casualties.
On 17 August 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, members of the Canaan Gang fired shots and attacked residents in the Rosemberg and Lilava neighbourhoods. Some civilians fled the area. Casualties unknown.
On 17 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Kenscoff, Ouest, unidentified individuals killed a member of the Vitelhomme gang (methods unknown) in Fort-Jacques neighbourhood. 1 fatality.
On 17 August 2023, in Santo, Ouest, members of the Canaan gang fired shots in the village as they tried to take the control of the area. Some residents fled their homes. Casualties unknown.

On 17 August 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a member of the Canaan Gang. The deceased was described also as the right hand of the Rosemberg Gang leader. The killing took place amidst a security operation carried out by the police after Canaan gangsters attacked residents in the commune earlier that day (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 17 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Belair Gang clashed with police forces as they attacked residents and set fire to four houses in the Solino, Nazon, and Fort National neighbourhoods. During clashes, two police officers were shot and injured. According to civilians, the gang offensive was a reprisal for the confiscation of a sum of money belonging to this gang by the police. Some civilians fled the area. Gunshots were also heard in the Carrefour Feuilles neighbourhood. At least 2 injured.

On 17 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang abducted the former coordinator of the National Police of Haiti Trade Union (SPNH) when he was driving to his residence. The victim was taken to Guedon village, although he was released later that day after the payment of 30,000 gourdes and the delivery of a bottle of rum.

Around 16 August 2023 (as reported), in Verrettes, Artibonite, a mob of residents chased and lynched several gangsters of unknown affiliation on the Canot road. The attack, that was described as vigilante violence, took place when the mobsters intercepted the gangsters trying to free the road from dividers erected on it. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 16 August 2023, near Pont Sonde, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked the National Road 1, at the height of Moreau Paye village, shooting and killing more than six civilians and injuring several others. The victims were said to be farmers. The gangsters looted and burned some houses. Some residents fled the area. At least 6 fatalities, several injured.

On 16 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified gang members in a vehicle opened fire on a tap-tap vehicle (taxi), shooting and killing at least five people travelling inside, and two people who were on the road, in Delmas 31 (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. At least 7 fatalities.

Around 16 August 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, a person was killed and his/her body was found around Rebecca and Lambert roads. The source suggests that the victim was lynched and informs that before the body was found, there were initial information that stones were being thrown and that there was a crowd of people. 1 fatality.

On 16 August 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang ambushed a police pickup vehicle in the La Croix-Perisse area, leading to a clash between the policemen and the gangsters, who set fire to the officers' vehicle and stole two assault riffles. The policemen fled the area in the absence of reinforcements to face the criminals. Casualties unknown.

Around 16 August 2023 (as reported), in Santo, Ouest, unidentified gang members clashed with police forces. During clashes, an unspecified number of civilians were killed and injured by the bullets, including a 4-year-old boy, his father, mother, uncles, and aunties. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 16 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the fourth consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang clashed with police forces as they attacked residents and tried to take the control of Savane Pistache, Trou Sable, and other areas of the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. During clashes, an unspecified number of civilians were killed and injured, and women were raped. Thousands of families fled the area and took refuge elsewhere in the capital. Some of the victims were said to have been targeted for their support of a self-defense group. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

Around 16 August 2023 (as reported), in Verrettes, Artibonite, police forces in an armored vehicle shot and killed several members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang during a security intervention (drive-by). Unknown casualties coded as 3.

Around 15 August 2023 (as reported), in Du Parc, Nippes, a gang member raped a woman. The victim identified the perpetrator as a member of the Grand-Ravine Gang. He was later killed by the police (coded separately). 1 injured.
Around 15 August 2023 (month of), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, the 400 Mawozo Gang kidnapped a US woman citizen. She was released after the payment of a 50,000 dollars ransom.

Around 15 August 2023 (month of), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members raped two women who were cousins at a house and then set the property on fire, in the Carrefour Feuilles neighbourhood. It happened during a gang offensive in the area.

On 15 August 2023, in Du Parc, Nippes, police forces shot and killed a member of the Grand-Ravine gang and a Base 5 Secondes member. One source stated that the Grand-Ravine gangster was intercepted by the police at a hospital compound, and that he was killed for having raped a woman (coded separately). This killing was described as an extrajudicial execution. 2 fatalities.

On 15 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang clashed with police forces as they attacked residents and tried to take the control of Savane Pistache, Trou Sable, and other areas of the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. During clashes, an unspecified number of civilians were killed and injured, and women were raped (coded separately). Thousands of families fled the area and took refuge elsewhere in the capital. Some of the victims were said to have been targeted for their support of a self-defense group. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 15 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, unidentified individuals shot and injured two police officers in Lamentin 54 area. Gunshots were heard in the area for several hours. 2 injured.
Around 15 August 2023 (month of), in Bon Repos, Ouest, members of the Canaan Gang killed a police officer in the Lilava neighbourhood. One perpetrator was arrested in January 2024. 1 fatality.

On 14 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, thousands of residents from the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood held a demonstration with tree branches and banners against insecurity and demanding a police intervention against gang violence in their community. During the mobilization in Champs de Mars, Capois Street, Bourdon, and Turgeau rioters set up barricades of burning tires. Tree trunks and tires were also used to block roads on Casseus Road in Pacot. Polices forces intervened using tear gas to disperse them. It happened amidst armed attacks targeting civilians in Carrefour-Feuilles by the Grand-Ravine gang which started on 4 August (coded separately).

On 14 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang clashed with police forces as they attacked residents and tried to take the control of Savane Pistache, Trou Sable, and other areas of the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. A police officer was shot and killed and his body was taken by the gangsters. Two other officers were injured. At least 16 civilians were killed, some of them were burned alive, others injured, and a number of women raped. As part of the offensive, the gangsters attacked the offices of the Electricity of Haiti company. Thousands of families fled the area and took refuge elsewhere in the capital. Some of the victims were said to have been targeted for their support of a self-defense group. At least 16 fatalities.

On 14 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang shot and killed a local municipal representative at his residence, in Decayette neighbourhood. Her son and wife were also killed. The attack was said to be a reprisal for the politician's support to a self-defense group. 3 fatalities.

On 13 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang clashed with police forces as they attacked residents and tried to take the control of Savane Pistache, Trou Sable, and other areas of the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. During the clash at least 28 civilians were killed, some burned. At least 12 others were injured, several by gunshots. An unspecified number of women were raped. Thousands of families fled the area and took refuge elsewhere in the capital as houses were set on fire and looted by the gangsters. Some of the victims were said to have been targeted for their support of a self-defense group. At least 28 fatalities.

On 13 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and killed two unidentified gangsters during a clash. A gun was seized by the officers. In a separate intervention, police forces shot and killed another gangster in the Caradeux neighbourhood. 3 fatalities.

On 12 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, rioters chased and hit several politicians by throwing objects of unknown nature against them at the Sainte Therese Park, as they were said not to be welcome to a ceremony being held in the honour of a deceased journalist. At least one political militant and a well-known lawyer were physically aggressed (methods unspecified). Security agents intervened (methods unknown) and prevented the rioters from lynching these individuals. Among the people who were forced to leave the place, there was a member of the Democratic and Popular Sector (SDP). Casualties unknown.

On 12 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the ninth consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked residents in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. A woman was shot and killed at her residence in Decayette (Martissant neighborhood). The gangsters set fire to the house and the corpse of the victim. Gunshots were also heard in Savane Pistache area. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of these attacks. At least 1 fatality.
On 11 August 2023, in Trou-du-Nord, Nord-Est, unidentified gang members opened fire on a bus in an ambush they had set up in the Bede area near Morne Cabrit. Casualties unknown.

On 11 August 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, members of the Canaan gang attacked residents and set fire to at least 10 houses in Onaville. The attack was described as a reprisal for the killing of eight members of the gang by police forces the day before (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 11 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the eighth consecutive day, in the early morning, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang fired gunshots and attacked residents in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Although the number of casualties was not clarified, residents reported people being injured and killed. Among the wounded, there was a woman who was shot at her residence. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of these attacks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3, at least 1 injured.
On 11 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, gang members attacked several people in the Caradeux neighbourhood, although no further details on the event were available. Casualties unknown.

On 10 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the seventh consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked residents in Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of these attacks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 10 August 2023, in Thomazeau, Ouest, the police shot and killed eight members of the Canaan Gang during an armed clash in Onaville, where they also seized a rifle as well as ammunition. Three other individuals were arrested. One of the deceased was the right arm of the Canaan gang leader. 8 fatalities.

On 9 August 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, a mob of residents lynched a man whom they accused of several killings. Two accomplices were arrested. The deceased victim was wanted by the police. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

On 9 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the sixth consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked residents in Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of these attacks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 8 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme Gang shot at civilians and stole from them. The gangster were seen near the United States embassy, the 15 Octobre Boulevard, the Office of Vehicle Insurance against Third Parties (OAVCT), and the Anti-Drug Trafficking Squad (BLTS). Members of said gang have been causing tension in the area for several weeks, causing businesses and institutions to close their doors, and residents to flee their homes. Due to the attacks, the embassy decided to suspend its activities until 9 August. Casualties unknown.

On 8 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the fifth consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked residents in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. A woman was shot and killed. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of these attacks. At least 1 fatality.
Around 8 August 2023 (between 4 - 12 August), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine gang raped two women and a girl as they attacked residents in Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood.
Around 8 August 2023 (as reported), in Bon Repos, Ouest, the police clashed with members of the Canaan Gang on Ti Bob Street, killing three of them. Motivation of the clash is unknown. 3 fatalities.

On 7 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the fourth consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine attacked residents in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. A man was shot and killed as he tried to enter his residence. His corpse was taken by the gangsters. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of these attacks. At least 1 fatality.
On 7 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, at night, gang members shot at civilians and stole from them. Casualties unknown.

On 7 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, thousands of people demonstrated against gang violence in the country. The demonstrators set fire to government vehicles and barricades of burning tires were erected in areas like Bourdon, Lalue, Turgeau, and Christophe Avenue. The demonstrators walked to the Prime Minister's office and police forces used tear gas to disperse the crowd to which rioters responded by throwing stones. The demonstration occurred after two attacks by members of the Grand-Ravine Gang in which at least two people were killed (coded separately).

On 7 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, police officers demonstrated in front of the National Old-Age Insurance Office (ONA) in Delmas 17 to denounce the fact that they are repaying loans that have not yet be given to them and demand the disbursement of said funds from the ONA-Polis program. They erected barricades off burning tires around and in front of ONA to prevent employees from accessing the premises.

On 7 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed an employee of the Ministry of the Interior and Territorial Collectivities (MICT) in his car while he tried to escape a kidnapping attempt. 1 fatality.

On 6 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, residents held demonstrations in several neighborhoods of Carrefour-Feuilles to denounce the killing of a police officer (coded separately) and ongoing gang violence in the area. The demonstrators erected barricades of burning tires.

On 6 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked residents in Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of these attacks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 5 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, residents of the Carrefour-Feuilles neighborhood demonstrated to urge police authorities to fight against gang violence in the area. The demonstrators erected barricades with burning tires, rocks and car wrecks in Saint-Honore road, Capois road, and the area of the National Palace.

On 5 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, the police clashed with members of the Grand-Ravine Gang as they were trying to take over the Savane Pistache police station and attacking residents in the area. Several people were killed among them a police officer. Residents were forced to flee their homes. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network (RNDDH) reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and three cases of collective rapes (coded separately), as part of the Grand-Ravine offensive against the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. At least 1 fatality.

On 5 August 2023, in Hinche, Centre, a police officer shot and killed a man after an altercation of unknown nature. The victim was described as a football player who also used to work as a taxi driver, although no further details on the circumstances of the event were available. 1 fatality.

On 4 August 2023, in Carrefour Paye, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, together with Kokorat San Ras gangsters, killed at least three men and injured several others. The motivations for the attack are unknown. The same day members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, together with Kokorat San Ras gangsters attacked civilians in Liancourt (coded separately). Five people were killed and several people were injured in both attacks. At least 3 fatalities.

On 4 August 2023, in Jeremie, Grande-Anse, people took to the streets to demand the reparation of the roads. The demonstrators erected barricades of stones and burning tires around Gebeaux neighborhood.

On 4 August 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, together with Kokorat San Ras gangsters attacked civilians and looted several properties. The gangsters raped at least three girls in front of their relatives. The same day members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang, together with Kokorat San Ras gangsters attacked civilians in Carrefour Paye (coded separately). Five people were killed and several people were injured in both attacks. At least 2 fatalities.

On 4 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine gang attacked residents in Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Between 4 and 12 August, the National Human Rights Defense Network reported 104 fatalities and missing people, and cases of collective rapes, as part of these attacks. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 3 August 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, citizens held a demonstration near the La Paix Hospital to demand the release of a doctor who was kidnapped a few days prior (coded separately). The demonstrators erected barricades of burning tires and cars on the road of Delmas 33.

On 31 July 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped a man who was the secretary of the Wise Movement of Patriots Organized for Unity Party in the Croix-Perisse neighbourhood. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 31 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, employees of the Epidemiology Laboratory and Research Department of the Public Health and Population (MSPP) held a demonstration in Delmas 33 to demand the liberation of the head of the institute, who had been kidnapped on 27 July (coded separately). Demonstrators set up barricades of burning tires.
On 30 July 2023, in Pilate, Nord, unidentified gang members raped a girl in the Marigot neighbourhood. No further information was available.

On 30 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped a woman while she was entering the Altagrace church in Delmas 46 with her husband. The kidnappers blocked all the church's entrances, ordered the main gate not to be opened, and managed to take the woman even after her husband tried to resist. There is no information on the perpetrators, but the latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

On 30 July 2023, in Petit Bourg du Borgne, Nord, in the early morning, police forces shot and killed a member and the leader of the Fausto Depena Gang during a security operation that aimed at seizing the leader of the organization. Three other gangsters were arrested and some weapons were seized. 2 fatalities.
On 30 July 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang shot at a police patrol in La Croix-Perisse neighbourhood, injuring a police officer. 1 injured.

On 29 July 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, residents killed at least six individuals (methods unknown). The victims were accused of being Kokorat San Ras and Baz Gran Grif de Savien gangsters. No further details were available, although the attack seems to be of a vigilante violence nature. At least 6 fatalities.

On 29 July 2023, in Drouet, Artibonite, armed residents from Chandelle village, who were described as members of a self-defense group, clashed with members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang in the Moreau Douet area near the Liancourt National School. The gangsters were preparing an attack against civilians. Seven gangsters were shot and killed and several were injured. An unspecified number of others managed to escape. The gangsters came back later to recover the corpses of the deceased. 7 fatalities, at least 2 injured.

On 28 July 2023, in Petite Riviere de l'Artibonite commune, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang attacked civilians, burned their bodies, and set fire to 11 houses in the Mirault village. At least 10 people were killed and several were injured. Among the fatal victims, there were a farmer man and a trader man. At least 10 fatalities, several injured.

Around 28 July 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, a mob of residents lynched and burned a man in the Pelerin neighbourhood. The victim was accused of being a thief of motorcycles. The body was left on the road. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

On 28 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, hundreds of citizens and several organizations, including the National Front of Organizations for a Stable and Democratic Haiti (FRONORHSD), held a march, the so called 'Long March', to demand the resignation of Primer Minister, Ariel Henry. Rioters set up barricades of burning tires. The march ended in the Musseau neighbourhood and was held on the occasion of the 108th anniversary of the US military landing in Haiti.

On 28 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, people took to the streets in commemoration of the U.S. occupation in Haiti. The march started at Carrefour de l'Aeroport, continued through Christ-Roi, towards Delmas where the demonstrators erected barricades (unspecified). Reports indicated the demonstrators had become violent (unspecified) in Delmas 75. The demonstration eneded in Petionville and it is unclear who intervened to disperse the demonstrators.
On 28 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gunshots were heard in the Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. They were said to be part of clashes between armed men and police forces. Casualties unknown.
On 28 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a gangster belonging to a gang operating in Cite Doudoune. The police seized a weapon. 1 fatality.

On 27 July 2023, near Casale, Ouest, unidentified gang members attacked a goods truck belonging to the RAMSA organization, shooting and killing at least two female traders travelling inside, in the Morne-a-Cabrit peak area. Several people were injured. At least 2 fatalities, at least 2 injured.

On 27 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, Ouest, a group of armed men kidnapped a US woman nurse and her girl at the campus of the 'Roi Haiti Outreach International' organization. The woman was working as a missionary for this Christian humanitarian organization when the abduction took place. The kidnappers asked for a ransom of 1 million dollars as a conditions for the victims' release. The victims were released on August 9.

On 27 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, an unknown number of armed men kidnapped a doctor and Head of the Epidemiology, Laboratory and Research Department of the Ministry of Public Health and Population (MSPP), when he was on his way home between Delmas 31 and 33. During the kidnapping, the victim was shot and injured, as it was confirmed during communications with the abductors, who asked the family for the payment of several ransoms as a condition for his release. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown. 1 injured.

Around 26 July 2023 (as reported), in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped an unspecified number of civilians in the Lilavwa neighbourhood. There is no information on the perpetrators and circumstances of these abductions, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.
Around 26 July 2023 (as reported), in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, the police killed the leader of the Vava Gang during a clash. 1 fatality.
On 25 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, members of the Grand-Ravine Gang attacked the Savane Pistache area, in Carrefour-Feuilles neighbourhood. Casualties unknown.

On 25 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, police forces used tear gas to disperse tens of residents who had taken refuge in the vicinity of the US Embassy since 23 July (coded separately), after Vitelhomme gangsters had attacked the Dumornay and Truitier neighbourhoods (coded separately). The group was integrated by around 450 civilians and 100 families with children, pregnant women, and elderly people. A video showed some of them on the floor suffering from suffocation. At least four minors and an elderly person were seriously injured from suffocation, including a 1-year-old baby. An armored tank was seen next to the Embassy. Following the dispersals, the refugees were transferred to a hosting site in Caradeux area. At least 5 injured.

On 25 July 2023, in Limbe, Nord, police forces shot and killed the leader of the Eliphete Albert Gang in an area known as 'Labapen'. According to the officers, they were carrying out a security operation when affiliates of the gang opened fire on them, leading to a clash. The police seized a weapon and ammunition. 1 fatality.

On 24 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, for the third consecutive day, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked residential areas and fired shots near the US Embassy, as they tried to take the control of the Dumornay and Truitier neighbourhoods. An unspecified number of civilians were killed and at least seven were injured by gunshots. Two women suffered from dislocations. An unknown number of residents fled the area. Around 450 civilians and 100 families took refuge in the vicinity of the US Embassy (coded separately). Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 July 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed at least three civilians and injured at least 10 others as they looted and set fire to tens of houses, businesses, the Antarctique Radio Station and an empty police station. Four civilians were burned inside their homes and four others were raped (gender specified, but probably women). At least 10 people were kidnapped. Their whereabouts are unknown. The attack was said to aimed at avenging the killing of gangsters by the Bwa Kale Movement (coded separately). At least 7 fatalities, at least 10 injured.

Around 23 July 2023 (as reported), in Santo, Ouest, at least 15 gang members riding motorcycles kidnapped six civilians in Santo 25 area. There was an engineer among the victims. Later that day, police forces intervened (methods unknown) and released the victims, although no interaction between the gangsters and police forces was mentioned. Eight vehicles were seized by the police.

On 23 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked residential areas in Fort-Jacques, Calebasse, and Greffin neighbourhoods, among other areas of the commune. An unspecified number of residents fled the area. Casualties unknown.

On 23 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, for the second consecutive day, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked residential areas and fired shots near the US Embassy, as they tried to take the control of the Dumornay and Truitier neighbourhoods. At least one man was killed in front of the Truitier temple, while at least two civilians were injured by gunshots. An unknown number of residents fled the area. Around 450 civilians and 100 families took refuge in the vicinity of the US Embassy (coded separately). At least 1 fatality, at least 2 injured.

On 23 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang ambushed a police patrol in the Vivy Mitchell area, shooting and injuring one officer. It happened as affiliates of this gang attacked residential areas in the commune (coded separately). 1 injured.

On 22 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped a man gynecologist doctor when he was leaving a supermarket in the commune. One source suggested that the Vitelhomme gang was behind this kidnapping. The wife of the doctor kept in contact with the kidnappers, although no ransom was formally demanded by the abductors. The woman went on a hunger strike until his husband be released, but she died around 31 July. The victim was released on 6 August and it is unclear if a ransom was paid.

On 22 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked residential areas in Fort-Jacques, Calebasse, and Greffin neighbourhoods, among other areas of the commune, injuring several people. At least two people were killed in Fort-Jacques. An unspecified number of residents fled the area. At least 2 fatalities.

On 22 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, members of the Vitelhomme gang attacked residential areas and fired shots near the US Embassy, as they tried to take the control of the Dumornay and Truitier neighbourhoods. An unspecified number of civilians were killed and injured, while an unknown number of residents fled the area. Around 450 civilians and 100 families took refuge in the vicinity of the US Embassy (coded separately). Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 22 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of people killed two gang members (methods unknown) in the Debussy area who were accused of being informants for kidnappers. 2 fatalities.

On 22 July 2023, near Casale, Ouest, unidentified gang members shot and injured two police officers who were on a patrol in the Morne a Cabrit peak area. The policemen were leaving an area under the control of the 400 Mawozo gang when they were ambushed, although it was not clarified whether the shooters belonged to this gang. 2 injured.

On 21 July 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang stopped a driver on the National Road 1, at the height of the Croix-Perisse neighbourhood, when he was transporting a group of people in a truck from Saint-Marc to Gonavies. The gangsters kidnapped some passengers and the driver. This one was later killed. According to witnesses, he was accused of transporting ammunition for a rival gang. The whereabouts of other the victims are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 21 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified gang members kidnapped a woman radio journalist on Catalpa Street, in Delmas 75. The victim was on her way home when the abduction took place. The kidnappers asked for a ransom of 300,000 USD as a condition for her liberation. She is known for presenting Radio Renovation FM. She was released on 30 July, after a ransom of unknown nature was paid.

On 20 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, hundreds of militants of several political parties from the opposition held a march against the government of Primer Minister Ariel Henry. Demonstrators demanded his resignation and decried insecurity, among other claims. The march passed through Port-au-Prince and Delmas. Police forces intervened using tear gas and clashed with demonstrations, who threw stones. Two journalists who were covering the event were beaten up by the officers in Delmas 60. Their materials were destroyed. The march was held on the occasion of the second anniversary of Henry's rising to power.

On 19 July 2023, in Croix-des-Bouquets, Ouest, overnight, unidentified gangsters attacked and occupied the facilities of the Rhum Bakara company, in the Noailles neighbourhood. During the attack, the gangsters threw Molotov cocktails, shot and killed two employees, and injured four others. At least three vehicles of the company were burned, eight good trucks were robbed, and at least eight employees were kidnapped. Their whereabouts are unknown. Police forces were present at the moment of the attack, although no intervention on their side was reported. The occupation persisted for at least three days. 2 fatalities, 4 injured.

On 19 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Kenscoff, Ouest, two men were shot and killed and their bodies were burned in the area of Fort-Jacques. The perpetrators accused the victims of being member of the Vitelhomme Gang. According to the source, 2 hours before they were killed, the victims were arrested by the police in collaboration with a vigilante group. 2 fatalities.

On 18 July 2023, in Petit-Goave, Ouest, people took to the streets to denounce that they did not received the wages they were entitled to after working for an engineer. The demonstrators erected barricades of burning tires at Devenn Crossroad on the National Road #2.

On 15 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, unidentified armed men in a vehicle shot and killed at least nine civilians in Mais Gate area (drive-by). The motivation for the attack is unknown. At least 9 fatalities.

Around 15 July 2023 (as reported), in Bon Repos, Ouest, members of the Canaan gang kidnapped several residents. There is no further information on the circumstances the abductions. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 14 July 2023, in Liancourt, Artibonite, in the morning, more than 50 members of the Baz Gran Grif de Savien Gang shot and killed five members of a self-defense group and injured 15 civilians (5 men and 10 women) as they opened fire on merchants preparing their stalls on the street. The gang members set fire to several houses, and vehicles, and looted some business. An unspecified number of civilians were kidnapped. The victims' whereabouts are unknown. 5 fatalities, 15 injured.

On 14 July 2023, in Drouet, Artibonite, members of the Baz Gran Grif the Savien gang shot and injured a member of the Timepri gang as they attacked the village. An unspecified number of civilians were killed and their corpses were found on the public road. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 14 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, unidentified gang members on motorcycles shot at the so called Omega police station, in Cote-Plage 16 (drive-by). There were no casualties.

On 13 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, a mob of residents burned the corpse of a Vitelhomme gangster in Fort-Jacques. He had been killed by the police moments before (coded separately). Later that day, another member of this gang was lynched in the village. These attacks were described as vigilante violence. 1 fatality.

On 13 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a member of the Vitelhomme gang in Fort-Jacques. His body was then burned by a mob of residents (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 13 July 2023 (as reported), in Bas-Limbe, Nord, masked agents of the police beat up a local member of the Councils of Administration of Communal Sections (CASEC) in front of his family and took him in a vehicle towards an isolated area. The victim was found and rescued by members of the population, who set fire to police vehicles as a reprisal (coded separately). According to the police, the person was taken to a police station and not to an isolated place as the man claimed.

On 13 July 2023, in Bas-Limbe, Nord, overnight, a group of rioters set fire to several vehicles and motorcycles belonging to police forces. The arson attack took place as a reprisal for the arrest and mistreatment of a local member of the Councils of Administration of Communal Sections (CASEC) by security forces and local authorities (coded separately). There were no casualties.

Around 12 July 2023 (as reported), in Thomazeau, Ouest, members of the Taliban gang kidnapped around 20 civilians in Onaville area. There is no further information on the circumstances of the abduction. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 12 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, members of the Ti Bwa gang shot and killed a man while he was driving a car in the Thor neighbourhood. It is known that the victim was an employee of the Office of Vehicle Insurance Against Thirds Parties (OAVCT), and a close person to the Carrefour police commissioner. 1 fatality.

On 12 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, a mob of residents lynched a man in Fort-Jacques. They accused him of being a member of the Vitelhomme gang. The attack was described as a vigilante justice. 1 fatality.

On 10 July 2023, in Johanisse, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped two vehicles transporting at least eight employees of the Blue Heaven Company. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.

On 10 July 2023, in the commune of L'Estere, Artibonite, six members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped and sexually assaulted a 17-year-old woman in the Croix-Perisse communal section. The attack took place when she was travelling in a public transport vehicle whose destination was Gonaives.

Around 10 July 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, unidentified gang members abducted a woman and her son on July 10. The victims were killed and their bodies set on fire. It is unclear whether the abduction and killing took place on the same day. 2 fatalities.

On 9 July 2023, in L'Estere, Artibonite, members of the Kokorat San Ras Gang kidnapped a police officer. He was interrogated by the gangsters and then released. It is not known the day the kidnapped was released. The interrogation was shared on social media.
On 9 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince, armed gang members shot and killed a police officer. There is no information on the circumstances of the attack. 1 fatality.
Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, several people have been kidnapped by unidentified suspects in Lalue. The whereabouts and the exact number of the victims remain unknown.

Around 7 July 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, several people have been kidnapped by unidentified suspects in Demas 83, and Delmas 33. The whereabouts and the exact number of the victims remain unknown.
On 7 July 2023, in Gonaives, Artibonite, police forces shot and killed a gang member during a police intervention in the Jubilee neighbourhood. 1 fatality.

On 7 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men shot and injured a police officer during a kidnapping attempt in Delmas 3. The officer managed to escape from being abducted. 1 injured.

On 6 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Tabarre, Ouest, overnight, around 20 armed men violently entered a hospital managed by Doctors Without Borders (nature of this violence unknown) and kidnapped a patient from an operating room. The victim was being intervened, as he had been injured by gunshots. The affiliation of the man was not clarified, although he was likely to be a rival to the kidnappers. The hospital suspended his activity following the incident. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 6 July 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men dressed in civil clothes shot and killed a man riding a motorcycle and set fire to his body, in the Lilavwa 11 neighborhood. The motivation and the perpetrators of the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.
On 6 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Petionville, Ouest, an unknown number of people were kidnapped by unidentified suspects in Pelerin 5. The whereabouts victims remain unknown.

On 6 July 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, police forces shot and killed a man in the Lilavwa 11 neighbourhood. The corpse was found on the public road. Witnesses confirmed the authorship of the killing. 1 fatality.

On 6 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped at least three civilians in Delmas 48. There was a doctor among the victims as well as a known woman in the area. There is no further information on the circumstances of the abductions and the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The perpetrators demanded a ransom as a condition for the release of the victims, whose whereabouts are unknown.

On 5 July 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men in a vehicle without license plate shot and killed at least four people (drive-by). Most of the victims were moto taxi drivers. The motivation for the attack is unknown. At least 4 fatalities.

On 5 July 2023, in Saint Michel du Sud, Nippes, police forces shot and killed a member of the Base 5 Secondes Gang during a security operation led by the police commissioner of Miragoane. The deceased was said to be a prison escapee. The execution was described as extrajudicial. 1 fatality.

On 4 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped at least two people in 'Kajou Boule' area, in Delmas 95. There is no further information on the circumstances of the abductions and the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victims are unknown.
Around 4 July 2023 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince - Cite Soleil, members of rival armed groups clashed. Clashes were reported for several days. Casualties unknown.

On 3 July 2023, in Bon Repos, Ouest, unidentified armed men on a motorcycle attacked the members of a family while they were attending the funeral of a relative (drive-by). Three members of the family and two men working as undertakers were killed. The motivation for the attack is unknown. 5 fatalities.
On 3 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, police forces clashed with members of the Base 5 Secondes Gang in the Bicentenaire and Portail Leogane areas. Casualties unknown.

On 2 July 2023, in Port-au-Prince - Delmas, Ouest, unidentified armed men kidnapped a person in Delmas 75. There is no further information on the circumstances of the abduction and the perpetrators, although latest reports suggest that most abductions are gang-related. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown.

On 1 July 2023, in Ganthier, Ouest, a mob of residents lynched two arrested gang members. The alleged gangs were held by the police who had arrested them the same day. The attack was described as vigilante violence. 2 fatalities.
